'''Music and political warfare''' have been used together in many different political contexts and cultures as a way to reach a targeted audience in order to deliver a specific political message. [[Political warfare]] as defined by Paul A. Smith is the "use of political means to compel an opponent to do one's will... commonly through the use of words, images and ideas."Smith, Paul A. On Political War, National Defense University Press, 1989, p 3 [[Music]] is useful because it creates an easily recognizable and memorable method of delivery for the desired message. Music is particularly useful medium for the delivery of [[propaganda]]. Jacques Ellul stated that for propaganda to be effective it must "fill the citizen's whole day and every day".Jacques Ellul. ''Propaganda: The Formation of Men's Attitudes''. Vintage Books, 1965, p 17. Since music is often viewed to be a leisure activity, it is often not considered to be as threatening as other [[propaganda techniques]], and as a result messages can often be surreptitiously communicated without being conspicuously noticed. ==American Revolution== During the [[American Revolution]], songs and poems were a very popular form of satire and also served as a medium for sharing the news and gossip of the day. As a result, many of the battles and skirmishes between the Americans and the British were retold and celebrated in the form of songs. [[Samuel Adams]] utilized music and protest songs in the mass public demonstrations he organized to protest British practices towards the American colonistsJ.Michael Waller. ''Propaganda the American Way'' After a humiliating retreat for the British-during which time the Americans engaged in the "ungentlemanly" act of firing at the backs of their retreating enemy -the British were immortalized in song:
How brave you went out with muskets all bright,
And thought to befrighten the folks with the sight;
But when you got there how they powder’d your pums,
And all the way home how they pepper’d your bums,
And is it not, honies, a comical farce,
To be proud in the face, and be shot in the arse.J.Michael Waller, ''Founding Political Warfare Documents of the American Revolution'', Crossbow Press, 2009, p 297
Perhaps the most well known song to emerge during this time was [[Yankee Doodle]]. Originally conceived by the British in an attempt to mock and demoralize the ragged American troops, it was instead adopted by the Americans as a rallying anthem.Waller, 319-320. In the language of the day, "doodle" referred to a fool or simpleton while "dandy" meant a gentleman of highly exaggerated dress and manners.{{cite web|url=http://www.earlyamerica.com/music/yankee-doodle.htm |title=Yankee Doodle Dandy - The Music of Early America |publisher=Earlyamerica.com |date=2013-12-05 |accessdate=2015-02-17}} Finally the term "macaroni" was a type of dress popular in Italy and widely imitated in England at the time. The song mocked the American's ragged and rough style of dress in comparison to the British armies distinct formal "red coat" uniform and portrayed the Americans as backwards and ignorant, a portrayal the Americans openly accepted. Thus instead of demoralizing the Americans, Yankee Doodle instead had the opposite effect of demoralizing the British who were later defeated by this army of "backwards and ignorant" individuals. ==Nazi Germany== One group who understood the role that music played in spreading their political message was the Nazis in Hitler's Germany. Clearly understanding the link between music and political warfare, propaganda minister Josef Goebbels once stated:
"Music affects the heart and emotions more than the intellect. Where then could the heart of a nation beat stronger than in the huge masses, in which the heart of a nation has found its true home?"{{cite web|url=http://holocaustmusic.ort.org/politics-and-propaganda/third-reich/ |title=Music and the Holocaust: General Overview |publisher=Holocaustmusic.ort.org |date= |accessdate=2015-02-17}}
Hitler made use of music glorifying Germanic legends, such as the works of Richard Wagner. Wagner's operas employed imagery of knights which Hitler then co-opted for images of himself Arnold Perris. Music as Propaganda: Art to Persuade, Art to Control. Greenwood Press, 1985, p52 Music was used within the Hitler Youth organization as a way to indoctrinate the youth of Germany into the Nazi's ideology. As part of their activities, group singing was a way to educate the young members of the group. According to an internal memo, songs were seen as "possess[ing] the strongest community building power".{{cite web|url=http://holocaustmusic.ort.org/politics-and-propaganda/third-reich/music-hitler-youth/ |title=Music and the Holocaust: Music amongst the Hitler Youth |publisher=Holocaustmusic.ort.org |date= |accessdate=2015-02-17}} ==Communism== Communist states such as the USSR and China have also utilized music as a way to spread their message of global communism. The [[Soviet Union]] sought to control the negative influences of music on the people and attempted to shape the messages being used in music to glorify the Soviet regime. Throughout Communist rule, the state sought to create legislation that in effect controlled the creative output of musicians and composers by limiting musical education, controlling which musicians could be employed and by only allowing "approved" musical performances-in short ensuring that all music was within keeping with Communist principles and ideology.Arnold Perris. M''usic as Propaganda: Art to Persuade, Art to Control''. Greenwood Press, 1985,72. Songs were often used in the revolutionary period because they could be easily shaped to have explicit and revolutionary messages set to a simple melody. In the [[People's Republic of China]], Chairman [[Mao Zedong]] believed that it was essential to employ national music in order to "reeducate" the Chinese people and make them accept Communist reforms. Mao stated that
"in music you may apply appropriate foreign principles and use foreign musical instruments. But still there must be national characteristics...The arts are inseparable from the customs, feelings and even the language of the people, from the history of the nation"Perris, 101.
In China under Mao's rule it became essential to re-educate artists and composers to turn away from traditional operas that often portrayed imperial China and espoused Buddhist and Confucian morals in their stories.Perris, 95 As a result, the Communist Party established an academy for the arts in Yan'an in 1937 which was intended to "rectify" the people of the arts and instruct them on how to incorporate the themes and objectives of the Communist Party into their worksPerris, 96 What has been seen in these countries however, does not conform with Communist views on art and artistic expression before the international Communist movement came to be under the rule of Stalinist bureaucracy. ==Other modern uses== In [[Uzbekistan]] there has been an increase in television programming that seeks to convey the regime's political and ideological messages. As a way to counter growing [[Islamic fundamentalism]], Uzbek television programming has vilified Islamists through the use of pop videos by a group called [[Setora]], a trio dubbed the "Tashkent Spice Girls".{{cite web|last=Aslan |first=Chris |url=http://www.cacianalyst.org/?q=node/509 |title=MILITARY MUSIC VIDEOS AS UZBEK POP PROPAGANDA | Central Asia-Caucasus Institute Analyst |publisher=Cacianalyst.org |date= |accessdate=2015-02-17}} Setora's music video tells the story of a young soldier, the boyfriend of one of three girls, who is sent away on a military assignment away from his loved one. Intertwined with this story are scenes of a mother and her children being taken captive by a highly caricatured Islamic extremist. As the video continues the soldier sweeps in to the rescue of the family, dying a hero in the process. The imagery of a mother is often used as a symbol for the state and in this case the state must be protected and preserved from the threat of Islamic extremism. The banning of music itself can also be a method of political warfare. This was the case in Afghanistan while the [[Taliban]] held power.[https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jrqUtwRti4QvO8X4_bShYsGbg2wQ ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100516064046/https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jrqUtwRti4QvO8X4_bShYsGbg2wQ |date=May 16, 2010 }} At the height of the insurgency in southern Somalia, the Islamist group [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] also banned music on radio stations it controlled.{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2010/mar/11/somalia-rebels-clash-in-air-wars/?page=2 |title=Somalia, rebels clash in air wars |publisher=Washington Times |date= |accessdate=2015-02-17}} Rebel outfits were seeking to establish Sharia law within the country and saw eliminating music as a way to purge society of what they deemed "evil actions".{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/04/16/AR2010041604894_2.html?sid=ST2010041604944 |title=For Somalis caught between Islamists and weak government, fleeing is only option |publisher=Washingtonpost.com |date=2010-04-16 |accessdate=2015-02-17}} ==Music and public diplomacy== Music has also been used as a successful tool for [[public diplomacy]], the so-called "softer" side of political warfare. One common technique employed by the [[United States Information Agency]] (USIA), once the center of the United States' entire public diplomacy strategy, was to arrange for musical exchanges. This was often done by scheduling tours of notable American musicians to foreign countries, especially those under Communist regimes, as a way to expose the average citizen to Americans and their culture. Another way that American music was used in public diplomacy was through radio programming on the [[Voice of America]]. Willis Conover's "Music USA" jazz programming that exposed foreign audiences to American jazz music through songs, interviews with artists and musicians as well as Conover's color commentary.[http://www.afsa.org/fsj/jul03/dizard.pdf] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070713045610/http://www.afsa.org/fsj/jul03/dizard.pdf |date=July 13, 2007 }} "Music USA" soon became one of VOA's most popular programs. ==See also== *[[Role of music in World War II]] *[[War of ideas]] *[[Public diplomacy]] *[[Political Warfare]] *[[Passive Revolution]] *[[Psychological Operations (United States)]] *[[Psychological Warfare]] *[[socialist realism]] *[[heroic realism]] *[[anarcho-punk]] *[[punk ideology]] *[[music and politics]] *[[Rock Against Racism]] *[[Rock Against Communism]] *[[National Socialist Black Metal]] *[[protest song]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Further reading== *''Songs That Fought The War: Popular Music and the Home Front, 1939-1945''. [[John Bush Jones]]. *''Heavy Metal Islam: Rock, Resistance, and the Struggle for the Soul of Islam''. Mark Levine. *Hebert, David G. and Kertz-Welzel, Alexandra, Eds. (2012). ''Patriotism and Nationalism in Music Education''. Aldershot, UK: Ashgate Press {{ISBN|1409430804}} ==External links== *[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/mark-levine/blog-posts-from-irans-met_b_217517.html ''"Is Music the Weapon of the Future in Iran?''" ] *[http://www.freedomgloryproject.com/ ''Freedom Glory Project: Iranian-American musicians, artists, and filmmakers united in keeping the struggle for freedom alive.''] *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uLqkiTlHHm8&feature=youtube_gdata ''Music During the Cold War''] *[http://www.psywarrior.com/ ''PsyWarrior''] {{DEFAULTSORT:Music And Political Warfare}} [[Category:Psychological warfare]] [[Category:Propaganda]] [[Category:Propaganda techniques]] [[Category:Propaganda art]] [[Category:Propaganda songs]] [[Category:Music and politics]]

{{advert|date=June 2017}} {{tone|date=June 2017}} {{Infobox school | name = New Image College | image = NIC Official Logo.png | alt = | caption = | motto = "Our Graduates Work" | city = [[Vancouver]] | province= [[British Columbia|BC]] | country = [[Canada]] | coordinates = | type = [[Private school|Private]] | established = 1980 | opened = | district = | principal = | faculty = | grades = | enrollment = | campus_type =Urban Campus | mascot = | newspaper = | website = {{URL|www.newimage.ca}} | footnotes = | address=Student Campus: 987 Granville St.

Corporate Offices: 543 Granville St. | president = [[Charie Van Dyke]] | colors = | feeders = }} '''New Image College''' (commonly abbreviated as '''NIC''') is a [[Private Career Training Institutions Agency|PTIB]]-accredited{{Cite web|url=http://www.privatetraininginstitutions.gov.bc.ca/|title=Private Training Institutions {{!}} Private Training Institutions Branch|website=www.privatetraininginstitutions.gov.bc.ca|language=en|access-date=2017-02-06}} [[Private school|private academy]] for film acting, makeup artistry, [[aesthetics]], [[Hairdresser|hairdressing]] and [[Nail art|nail design]] located in downtown [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]].{{Cite web|url=http://vancouver.ca/|title=City of Vancouver|last=Vancouver|first=City of|date=2016-09-26|website=vancouver.ca|language=en-US|access-date=2017-02-06}} New Image College consists of two locations: their main student campus is located at [[Granville Street|Granville]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.tourismvancouver.com/vancouver/neighbourhoods/granville-street/|title=Guide to Vancouver Neighbourhoods: Granville Street|website=www.tourismvancouver.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-02-06}} and Nelson and their corporate offices at Granville and Pender. New Image College is EQA{{Cite web|url=http://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/education-training/post-secondary-education/institution-resources-administration/education-quality-assurance|title=Education Quality Assurance - Province of British Columbia|last=Education|first=Ministry of Advanced|website=www2.gov.bc.ca|language=en|access-date=2017-02-06}}-designated by the BC [[Higher education in British Columbia|Ministry of Education]],{{Cite web|url=http://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/organizational-structure/ministries-organizations/ministries/education|title=Ministry of Education - Province of British Columbia|last=Services|first=Ministry of Technology Innovation and Citizens|website=www2.gov.bc.ca|language=en|access-date=2017-02-06}} and a Designated Learning Institution with CIC. New Image College is a branch of the multimedia and venture capitalist corporation Global Model and Talent Inc., which is a multi-faceted organization comprising New Image Entertainment,{{Cite web|url=http://www.newimageentertainment.ca/|title=NewImage Entertainment – NIE|website=www.newimageentertainment.ca|language=en-US|access-date=2017-02-06}} LD Vacations, ShyDaTry Service and Product Inc., Phrike Film Festival,{{Cite web|url=http://www.phrikefilmfest.com/|title=Phrike Filmfest 72 Hours competition|website=Phrike Filmfest 72 Hours competition|access-date=2017-02-06}} NIC Spa Inc.{{Cite web|url=http://www.nicspa.ca/|title=Home - NICSpa|website=NICSpa|language=en-US|access-date=2017-02-06}} and other numerous ventures. == History == New Image College was founded in 1980 by the Canadian-born husband and wife team Bill and Charlotte Dyck.{{Cite web|url=http://www.taborhome.org/about-us/board-of-directors/bill-dyck.php|title=Bill Dyck {{!}} Tabor Village|website=www.taborhome.org|access-date=2017-02-06}} Both were extensively trained as [[Physiology|clinical marriage and family physiologist]], with years of [[Philanthropy|philanthropy work]]{{Cite web|url=https://yfccanada.org/|title=Youth for Christ Canada|website=yfccanada.org|language=en|access-date=2017-02-06}} within [[British Columbia|BC]] and around the world, specifically [[India]] and [[China]]. The pair conceived New Image with the goal of providing an opportunity for abused women to develop a "new image" for themselves. Initially focusing on [[fashion design]], etiquette courses, and self-confidence seminars, the business was considerably expanded when it was taken over by their daughter, [[Charie Van Dyke]]. Under the guidance of New Image College President Van Dyke and her husband, Vice President John Craig, the business would develop into one of the most respected and successful private academies in Canada, boasting over 25,000 alumni. As of 2016, New Image has expanded even further after acquiring their 'Creative Arts Campus' on the corner of [[Granville Street|Granville and Nelson]]. New Image College recently rebranded itself with the name "NIC" alongside the launch of its NIC Spa line. The NIC Spa on Granville, a private branch of Global Model & Talent, provides opportunities for alumni of New Image College's [[aesthetics]] program to begin their [[small business]]es through the college's Entrepreneurial Program. == New Image Entertainment == New Image Entertainment is an independent film production company located in [[Vancouver]], British Columbia, Canada. New Image Entertainment is subsidiary of New Image College, originally developed to produce short-length and feature-length films, utilizing the talents of their parent student body. New Image Entertainment has produced over 100 independent productions, including the features [[Star Vehicle (film)|''Star Vehicle (aka'' ''Bleading Lady)'']], which has been released internationally on DVD, ''[[Famine (film)|Famine]]'',{{cite web|url=http://www.shuizmz.com/trailer-ryan-nicholsons-famine-2011/| title=Ryan Nicholson's Famine| publisher=Shu-Izms Horror News| accessdate=May 3, 2011}} and ''Bad Building''. ==See also== * [[Higher education in British Columbia]] ==Notes and references== {{Reflist|30em}} {{BC Uni|state=expanded|private=yes|college=yes}} {{coord|49.284072|N|123.112214|W|source:dewiki_region:CA-BC_type:landmark|format=dms|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:New Image College Of Fine Arts}} [[Category:Universities and colleges in Vancouver]] [[Category:Drama schools in Canada]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1980]] [[Category:Art schools in Canada]] [[Category:Cinema of British Columbia]] [[Category:Entertainment companies of Canada]] [[Category:Film production companies of Canada]]

{{Attached KML}} {{Infobox street | name = Nyhavn | native_name = | image = Nyhavn MichaD.jpg | image_size = 320px | caption = Colourful facade and old ships along the Nyhavn Canal | former_names = | location = [[Indre By]], [[Copenhagen]], [[Denmark]] | postal_code = 1051 | length_m = 450 | width = | metro = [[Kongens Nytorv station|Kongens Nytorv]] | coordinates = {{coord|55|40|47|N|12|35|26|E}} }} '''Nyhavn''' ({{IPA-da|ˈnyhɑwˀn}}; New Harbour) is a 17th-century waterfront, canal and entertainment district in [[Copenhagen]], [[Denmark]]. Stretching from [[Kongens Nytorv]] to the harbour front just south of the [[Royal Danish Playhouse|Royal Playhouse]], it is lined by brightly coloured 17th and early 18th century [[townhouse]]s and bars, cafes and restaurants. The canal harbours many historical wooden ships.
==History== Nyhavn was constructed by [[Christian V of Denmark|King Christian V]] from 1670 to 1673, dug by Swedish prisoners of war from the [[Dano-Swedish War (1658–1660)|Dano-Swedish War 1658–1660]]. It is a gateway from the sea to the old inner city at [[Kongens Nytorv]] (King's Square), where ships handled cargo and fishermens' catch. It was notorious for beer, sailors, and prostitution. Danish author [[Hans Christian Andersen]] lived at Nyhavn for some 18 years.
The first bridge across Nyhavn opened on [[1875 in Denmark|6 February 1875]]. It was a temporary wooden footbridge.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://vaeggen.copenhagen.dk/media/666 |title=Nyhavns Bro under nedbrydning |work=Københavns Museum |accessdate=2 January 2012 |language=Danish }}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> It was replaced by the current bridge in 1912.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nyhavns-skipperlaug.dk/Wikka/wikka.php?wakka=AnDet |title=Nyhavns historie |language=Danish |work=Nyhavns Skipperlaug |accessdate=2 January 2011}}</ref>
[[File:Nyhavn, Copenhagen (Denmark) 01.jpg|left|thumb|The canal]] As ocean-going ships grew larger, Nyhavn was taken over by internal Danish small vessel freight traffic. After World War II land transport took over this role and small vessel traffic disappeared from the Port of Copenhagen, leaving Nyhavn largely deserted of ships.
In the mid-1960s, the Nyhavn Society (Danish: Nyhavnsforeningen) was founded with the aim of revitalising the area. In 1977, Nyhavn was inaugurated as a veteran ship and museum harbour by Copenhagen’s Lord Mayor [[Egon Weidekamp]]. In 1980 Nyhavn quay was [[pedestrianised]]; it had been used as a parking area in the previous years which had coincided with a dwindling of harbour activities.<ref name=publicspaces >{{cite book |last1=Gehl |first1=Jan |last2=Gemzøe |first2=Lars |title=Public Spaces, Public Life, Copenhagen |year=1996 |isbn=877-407-305-2 |publisher=The Danish Architectural Press and the Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts |page=20}}</ref> Since then it has become a popular spot for tourists and locals alike, serving the function of a square according to architects [[Jan Gehl]] and Lars Gemzøe.<ref name=publicspaces />
==Buildings== [[File:Nyhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark.jpg|thumb|600 px|Panorama of north side of Nyhavn]] The northern side of Nyhavn is lined by brightly coloured townhouses built with wood, bricks, and plaster. The oldest house, at No. 9, dates from 1681.
Between 1845 and 1864, [[Hans Christian Andersen]] lived at No. 67, where a memorial plaque now stands. From 1871-1875 Andersen lived at Nyhavn 18,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://visithcandersen.dk/nyhavn_18.htm/ |title=Nyhavn 18 |work=H. C. Andersen Information |accessdate=31 January 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170416161134/http://www.visithcandersen.dk/nyhavn_18.htm |archivedate=16 April 2017 |df= }}</ref> which currently houses an Andersen-themed souvenir shop.
The southern side of Nyhavn has lavish mansions lining the canal, including [[Charlottenborg Palace]] at the corner of Kongens Nytorv.
==Veteran Ship and Museum Harbour== [[File:Nyhavn pano.jpg|thumb|600 px|Panorama looking across Nyhavn, from south side to north, with the lightship in foreground, and other museum ships]] Nyhavn Veteran Ship and Museum Harbour, occupying the inner section of Nyhavn, between the Nyhavn Bridge and Kongens Nytorv, is lined with old ships. From the foundation of the heritage harbour in 1977, the south side of the canal has been reserved for museum ships owned by the [[National Museum of Denmark|Danish National Museum]], which received a donation of carefully restored ships from [[A. P. Moller-Maersk Group|A. P. Møller]], while the northern side of the canal was put at the disposal of the Nyhavn Society and privately owned, still usable wooden ships. Harbor ships include: * ''[[Lightvessel Gedser Rev|Lightvessel XVII Gedser Rev]]'' – [[lightvessel]] built in [[Odense]] in 1895, in operation until 1972, then acquired by the National Museum and now serving as a museum ship. * ''Svalan af Nyhavn'' – galease built in Jungfrusund in 1924 * ''Anna Møller'' – galease built in [[Randers]] in 1906 * ''MA-RI'' – purpose-built smuggling ship built in 1920; [[Boarding (attack)|boarded]] by custom authorities off [[Helsingør|Elsinore]] with smuggling goods aboard in 1923, then confiscated and sold on auction, then operated both as a fishing vessel and as a ferry between [[Poland]] and [[Bornholm]], again as a smuggling vessel. * ''Mira'' – two-masted [[schooner]] built in [[Fåborg]] in 1898, considered one of the finest ships of the Danish small vessel traffic of the time. For many years it transported [[chalk]] from [[Stevns Peninsula|Stevns]]. The first ship on the north side of Nyhavn, coming from Kongens Nytorv. * ''[[Bådteatret|The Boat Theatre]]'' - a [[Lighter (barge)|lighter]]-type [[barge]] built in Copenhagen in 1898, since 1972 operated as a theatre boat.
==The Memorial Anchor== [[Image:Anker Nyhavn.jpg|right|thumb|The Memorial Anchor at the end of Nyhavn]] The great Memorial Anchor (Danish: Mindeankeret) at the end of Nyhavn, where it meets Kongens Nytorv, is a monument commemorating the more than 1,700 Danish officers and sailors in service for the [[Royal Danish Navy|Navy]], merchant fleet or [[Allies of World War II|Allied Forces]], who sacrificed their lives during [[World War II]]. The Anchor was inaugurated in 1951, replacing a temporary wooden cross erected on the spot in 1945, and has a plaque with a monogram of King [[Frederik VII of Denmark|Frederik VII]] on it. The Memorial Anchor is from 1872 and was used on the Frigate Fyn (Funen), which was docked at [[Holmen naval base|Holmen Naval Base]] during the Second World War. Every year on May 5 – Denmark’s Liberation day 1945 – an official ceremony is held to honour and commemorate the fallen at the Memorial Anchor.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.copenhagenet.dk/CPH-Nyhavn.htm |title=Nyhavn |work=Copenhagen Portal |accessdate=3 August 2009}}</ref>
==Bars and restaurants== [[Image:Nyhavn 24-6-2003.JPG|right|thumb|Bars and restaurants lining the northern, sunny side of Nyhavn]] Along its northern, sunnier side, Nyhavn is lined with bars and restaurants facing the harbor. Nyhavn serves as a hub of canal tours.
==Transport== [[Kongens Nytorv station|Kongens Nytorv metro station]] is located at the end of Nyhavn, though situated at the far end of the namesake square outside [[Magasin du Nord]]. The station is served by both lines [[M1 (Copenhagen)|M1]] and [[M2 (Copenhagen)|M2]] of the [[Copenhagen Metro]].
The [[Copenhagen Harbour Buses]] has a stop at the mouth of Nyhavn. All four routes of the harbour buses, [[Copenhagen Harbour Buses#901 & 902|Routes 901, 902]], [[Copenhagen Harbour Buses#903|903]] and [[Copenhagen Harbour Buses#904|904]], stop at the bus stop next to the [[Royal Danish Playhouse|Royal Playhouse]].
In 2016 the [[Inderhavnsbroen|Inner Harbor Bridge]] (Inderhavnsbro) connecting Nyhavn and Christianshavn was opened after years of setbacks and delays. The 180 m cycling and pedestrian [[drawbridge]] has been nicknamed the Kissing Bridge because its contour resembles two tongues meeting.<ref>{{cite web |title=Surprise! Long-delayed Copenhagen Bridge Opens |url=http://www.thelocal.dk/20160708/copenhagen-inner-harbour-bridge-inderhavnsbroen-opens |date=8 July 2016 |work=[[The Local]] DK |accessdate=19 February 2017}}</ref>
==Cultural references== ===Film=== * Nyhavn has been seen in numerous Danish films. It is for instance used as a location in a number of ''[[Olsen-banden]]'' films, for instance at 0:25:44 in ''[[The Olsen Gang on the Track]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.olsenbande-homepage.de/index3.html|title=Film 7 Olsen banden på sporet / Die Olsenbande stellt die Weichen|language=German|website=olsenbande-homepage.de|accessdate=5 October 2017}}</ref> and at 0:28:56 in the 1977 [[Olsen Gang]] film ''[[The Olsen Gang Outta Sight]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.olsenbande-homepage.de/index3.html|title=Film 9 Olsen Banden deruda / Die Olsenbande schlägt wieder zu|language=German|website=olsenbande-homepage.de|accessdate=5 October 2017}}</ref> The Memorial Anchor is seen at 1:16:57 in ''[[The Olsen Gang Sees Red]]''..<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.olsenbande-homepage.de/index3.html|title=Film 8 Olsen Banden ser rødt / Die Olsenbande sieht rot|language=German|website=olsenbande-homepage.de|accessdate=8 October 2017}}</ref>
Nyhavn has also been featured in a number of international films. * The closing scenes of [[Ingmar Bergman]]'s ''[[A Lesson in Love]]'' takes place in Nyhavn.<ref name=Filmby>{{cite web|url=http://www.ekkofilm.dk/artikler/filmby-copenhagen/|title=Filmby Copenhagen|website=Ekko|accessdate=9 October 2017}}</ref> * In the 1957 British-American action film ''[[Hidden Fear]]'', Nyhavn is used as a central location. * In the 1960 [[Alfred Hitchcock]] spy film ''[[Torn Curtain]]'', Curtain ([[Paul Newman]]), who is on the way to DDR, is told to contact a used book seller at Kanalgade 1 which later turns out to be Nyhavn when his fiancée (Julie Andrews) visits the address.<ref name=Filmby/> * In the 1963 German film ''{{Interlanguage link multi|Das Feuerschiff|de|3=Das Feuerschiff (1962)|lt=Das Feuerschiff}}'', Nyhavn is used as a location in spite of the fact that the film is set in Germany. * In the 2015 drama film ''[[The Danish Girl (film)|The Danish Girl]]'', Nyhavn is the location where [[Lili Elbe|Einar]] ([[Eddie Redmayne]]) and [[Gerda Wegener|Gerda]] ([[Alicia Vikander]]) live, and it is also where Lili makes her first forays in public. Nyhavn is in the film presented as a fish market while Copenhagen's historic fish market was in fact located at [[Gammel Strand]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.visitdenmark.com/denmark/tour-danish-girl-locations|title=Tour The Danish Girl locations|website=visitdenmark.dk|accessdate=9 October 2017}}</ref>
===Literature=== * Elisabeth Levy's 1997 novel ''Et dukkehus i Nyhavn'' (''A Doll House in Nyhavn'') describes a young girls life in Nyhavn in 1929. * [[Anne Marie Ejrnæs]]'s 2002 biographical novel ''Som Svalen'' (''Like the Swallow'') about [[Thomasine Christine Gyllembourg-Ehrensvärd|Thomasine Gyllenbourg]] begins when she is eight years old and lives in her father's home at [[Nyhavn 67]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gyldendal.dk/produkter/anne-marie-ejrnæs/som-svalen-42032/andet-9788702206463|title=Som svanen|language=Danish|website=Gyldendal|accessdate=21 January 2018}}</ref> * [[Karin Michaëlis]]'s 1936 children's book ''Lotte Ligeglad'' is about a girl who lives in Nyhavn where her mother owns a shop next to a tavern.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://denstoredanske.dk/Historien_om_børnelitteratur/Børnene,_de_værgeløse_-__børnelitteraturen_1918-1964/Pigeromanerne/Karin_Michaelis|title=Karin Michaëlislocations|website=denstoredanske.dk|accessdate=21 January 2017}}</ref>
===Music=== * ''Nu går våren gennem Nyhavn'' is a song by Sigfred Pedersen with melody by [[Niels Clemmensen]].
==See also== * [[Tourism in Denmark]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== {{Commons}} * [http://www.copenhagenet.dk/CPH-Map/CPH-Nyhavn.asp Copenhagen-Portal - Nyhavn] * [http://rejsefortaelling.dk/nyhavns_huse/nyhavns_huse.htm Source]

revision.text:
{{Infobox company |name = PassmoreLab |logo = File:PassmoreLab Vector Logo.pdf |type = [[Privately held corporation|Private]] |foundation = August 2001 |founder = Greg Passmore |Head Office = |location_city = San Diego, California |location_country = USA |location = |locations = |origins = |key_people = Greg Passmore, CEO

Jennifer Hilbert, CFO

James Humann, Director of Business Affairs and Development

Sabine Bredow, Senior Production Coordinator |area_served = |industry = Film and Television |services = 3D conversion of catalog films, new releases, documentaries, trailers, commercials, and music videos. Native 3D production services for features, shorts, documentaries, commercials, and music videos. |products = Library of films and music videos |revenue = |operating_income = |net_income = |num_employees = |parent = |subsid = |owner = |caption = |homepage = http://www.passmorelab.com |division = |footnotes = |intl = }} '''PassmoreLab''' is a [[San Diego]]-based [[stereoscopic]] [[3D film]] studio that specializes in [[2D to 3D conversion|conversion of 2D films to 3D format]], native [[3D Film|3D film productions]], and 3D film distribution. ==Background== As an independent film production company, PassmoreLab produces its own [[3D film]]s, including science and nature shorts, broadcast television programming, and [[documentary]] and [[feature films]]. It also has a separate distribution and sales division that licenses 3D content to independent theaters, [[Science museum#Science_center|science centers]], [[museums]], [[planetarium]], [[3D television]] broadcasts, and 3D [[mobile device]]s.{{cite web | url=http://exploreworldtv.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=274:passmorelabs-3d-content-now-mobile-on-spatial-views-3deecentralcom&catid=27:technology&Itemid=30 | title=PassmoreLab’s 3D Content Now Mobile on Spatial View’s 3DeeCentral.com | work=Explore World TV | date=March 28, 2010 | accessdate=July 1, 2011 | author=Cadulla, Al}} PassmoreLab licenses its conversion technology and also converts films “in-house.” Films Passmore has worked on include ''[[Plan 9 from Outer Space]]'',{{cite web | url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/20611 | title=Ha! Ed Wood's Disasterpiece 'Plan 9' Gets 3-D Treatment! | publisher=[[Bloody Disgusting]] | date=June 17, 2010 | accessdate=July 1, 2011 | author=Mr. Disgusting}}{{cite web | url=http://www.geekosystem.com/plan-9-outer-space-3d/ | title=Your Stupid Minds! Plan 9 From Outer Space Coming Back from the Dead in 3D | publisher=[[Geekosystem]] | date=June 14, 2010 | accessdate=July 1, 2011 | author=Quigley, Robert}} the restored, [[colorize]]d version of ''[[Night of the Living Dead]]'',{{cite web | url=http://www.digitalcinemareport.com/node/2354 | title=Spatial View Signs Licensing Agreement for PassmoreLab 3D Content | work=Digital Cinema Report | date=April 14, 2011 | accessdate=July 1, 2011}} ''Iron Doors'',{{cite web | url=http://www.studentfilmmakers.com/news/Iron_Doors_3D_Wins_Best_3D_Feature_Award.shtml | title=Iron Doors 3D Wins Best 3D Feature Award | work=Student Filmmakers | date=October 16, 2010 | accessdate=July 1, 2011 | author=staff}} ''[[The Nutcracker in 3D]]'',{{cite web | url=http://www.emanuellevy.com/comment/central-partnership-secures-the-nutcracker-in-3d-8/ | title=Central Partnership Secures The Nutcracker in 3D | publisher=emanuellevy.com | date=May 4, 2010 | accessdate=July 1, 2011}}{{cite web | url=http://thirdmagazine.com/2009/11/15/nutcracker-3d-zemeckis-loves-christmas-and-3d-motion-capture/ | title=Nutcracker 3D – Zemeckis loves Christmas and 3D motion capture | publisher=Third Magazine | date=November 15, 2009 | accessdate=July 1, 2011 | author=The James}} and ''Ocean Voyagers'' narrated by [[Meryl Streep]].{{cite web | url=http://www.etcenter.org/2011/06/premiere-set-for-passmorelabs-latest-3d-nature-documentary-ocean-voyagers-3d/ | title=Premiere Set for PassmoreLab’s Latest 3D Nature Documentary – Ocean Voyagers 3D | publisher=Entertainment Technology Center | date=June 2, 2011 |accessdate=July 1, 2011}} The company also does production for music videos and has worked alongside [[Osaka Popstar]],{{cite web | url=http://marketsaw.blogspot.com/2013/05/osaka-popstar-and-passmorelab-announce.html#.UdSRVVHFU19 | title=Osaka Popstar and Passmorelab Announce Debut of 3D music videos on the Nintendo 3DS | publisher=marketsaw.blogspot.com | date=May 22, 2012 | accessdate=July 2, 2012}} [[Slash (musician)|Slash]],{{cite web | url=http://top40-charts.com/news.php?nid=58865&string=Revolver | title=Slash In 3D! Guitarist Teams Up With Passmorelab To Convert Latest Video 'By The Sword' To 3D | publisher=top40-charts.com | date=September 1, 2010 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}}{{cite web | url=http://www.musicpix.net/index.php/news/slash_teams_up_with_passmorelab_to_convert_music_video_to_3d/ | title=Slash Teams up with PassmoreLab to convert Music Video to 3D! | publisher=musicpix.net | date=September 3, 2010 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} [[Plain White T's]],{{cite web | url=http://www.steveglum.com/?tag=passmorelab | title=Plain White T’s #1 on iTunes Album Rock Charts is now in 3D with PassmoreLab | publisher=steveglum.com | date=Jan 21, 2011 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=Steve Glum}} [[Semi Precious Weapons]],{{cite web | url=http://www.3dcameracompany.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=121%3A3d-film-production&id=25%3Apassmorelab-produces-3d-music-video-for-semi-precious-weapons&Itemid=27 | title=PassmoreLab Produces 3D Music Video for 'Semi Precious Weapons' | work=3D Camera Company | date=October 14, 2008 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}}{{cite web | url=http://www.digitalcinemareport.com/node/2354 | title=Spatial View Signs Licensing Agreement for PassmoreLab 3D Content | publisher=Digital Cinema Report | date=April 14, 2011 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}}[[Linkin Park]], and {{cite web | url=http://indiefilm3d.com/be-film-animated-festival-opens-may-3rd-new-york | title=Be Film Animated Festival Opens May 3rd in New York | work=Indie Film 3D | date=May 14, 2011 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=Nick Dager}}[[Devo]].{{cite web | url=http://indiefilm3d.com/devo%E2%80%99s-monster-man-3d-debut-next-month-france | title=Devo’s Monster Man 3D to Debut Next Month in France | publisher=Indie Film 3D | author=Nick Dager}} ==History== In 2007, PassmoreLab announced development of its prototype multi-camera array,{{cite web | url=http://vroot.org/node/4761 | title=PassmoreLab Creates Prototype Multi-Camera Array for 3D Imaging | publisher=vroot.org | date=December 14, 2011 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=Greg Passmore}} and by 2008 the lab had created a 3D documentary film on [[Burning Man]].{{cite web | url=http://stage.videography.com/article/58128 | title=PassmoreLab Creates 3D Documentary on Burning Man Festival | work=Videorgraphy Magazine | date=August 2, 2008 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=staff}} Passmore then expanded its work to include [[stereoscopic]] [[microscopy]].{{cite web | url=http://www.3dcameracompany.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=27:passmorelab-expands-work-to-include-stereoscopic-microscopy&catid=96:ind-news&Itemid=7 | title=PassmoreLab Expands Work to Include Stereoscopic Microscopy | publisher=3D Camera Company | date=October 2, 2008 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} The company began converting [[Ripley's Believe It or Not!|Ripley]]’s film archives into 3D format.{{cite web | url=http://www.iaapa.org/industry/funworld/2009/feb/departments/IndustryNotes.asp | title=Lucid Dreams Converting Ripley’s Film Library to 3D | work=[[International Association of Amusement Parks and Attractions]] | date=February 2009 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=Keith Miller}} The company produced a [[music video]] with [[Sammy Hagar]],{{cite web | url=http://www.3dmonitorsmart.com/a392173-lucid-dreams-passmorelab-produces-d-video-with.cfm | title=Lucid Dreams/PassmoreLab Produces 3D Video with Rocker Sammy Hagar | publisher=3dmonitorsmart.com | date=November 1, 2008 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} won several awards at the inaugural 3-D Film & Interactive Festival (3DFF) held in [[Orlando]] and [[Cocoa Beach, Florida]].{{cite web | url=http://www.3dnatura.com/a402403-passmorelab-wins-audience-award-at-dff.cfm | title=PassmoreLab Wins Audience Award at 3DFF | publisher=3dnatura.com | date=November 26, 2008 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} The company also converted the film ''[[Night of the Living Dead]]'' into 3D format. In 2009, PassmoreLab converted [[MGM Studios]] simulator ride ''[[Stargate games#Stargate-3000|Stargate 3000]]'' from 2D to 3D.{{cite web | url=http://sg1.tv-series.com/default.asp?ModuleID=2&PageID=12&ArticleID=50846 | title=MGM´s Stargate SG-3000 Thrill Ride | publisher=sg1.tv-series.com | date=May 26, 2009 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=Gillian}}{{cite web | url=http://www.iaapa.org/industry/funworld/2009/aug/departments/IndustryNotes.asp | title=PassmoreLab Brings New Dimension to ‘Stargate’ | work=[[International Association of Amusement Parks and Attractions]] | date=August 2009 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=Keith Miller}} and with its conversion of Anthony Lucas' 1999 [[claymation]] film ''Slim Pickings'', became the first in the industry to convert [[claymation|clay animation]] to 3D.{{cite web | url=http://www.screenhub.co.nz/news/shownewsarticleG.asp?newsID=25246 | title=Anthony Lucas: world first claymation short converted to 3D (Lucas surprised) | publisher=screenhub.co.nz | date=January 30, 2009 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} In 2009 ''[[ABC News]]'' ''[[Nightline]]'' interviewed company founder Greg Passmore about his new science documentary "The Extreme Nature of Bats".{{cite web |url= http://abcnews.go.com/video/playerindex?id=8962985 |title= Like a Bat Out of Water |last1=Wright |first1=David |date= 2009-10-30 |publisher=[[ABC News]]/[[Nightline]]}} PassmoreLab also completed and premiered their 3D conversion of ''Night of the Living Dead, Now in 3D!'' at the [[Hollywood Forever Cemetery]] as a part of the 5th Annual [[Johnny Ramone]] Memorial Tribute.{{cite web | url=http://www.roadrunnerrecords.com/BLABBERMOUTH.net/news.aspx?mode=Article&newsitemID=127169 | title=Johnny Ramone Tribute to be held at Hollywood Forever Cemetery - Sep. 17, 2009 | publisher=roadrunnerrecords.com | date=August 18, 2009 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} In 2010, PassmoreLab held the world premiere of its [[psychological thriller]] [[feature film]] ''Iron Doors 3D''. The film won 'Best 3D Feature Film' (Narrative) at the Hollywood 3D Film Festival, and then screened at the [[Raindance Film Festival]] in [[London]], the [[Hof, Bavaria#Periodic events|HOF Film Festival]] in [[Munich]], and [[American Film Market]] in Los Angeles.{{cite web | url=http://www.filmfestivalpost.com/?p=15 | title=Iron Doors 3D Wins Best 3D Feature Award | publisher=The Film Festival Post | date=October 2010 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} Also in 2010, Passmore completed the first-ever 3D music video for [[Slash (musician)|Slash]]'s ''[[By the Sword (song)|By the Sword]]'' with [[Andrew Stockdale]], and ''[[Beautiful Dangerous]]'' with [[Fergie (singer)|Fergie]]. as well as completing 3D music videos for [[Linkin Park]]'s ''[[Waiting for the End (Linkin Park song)|Waiting for the End]]'', and for [[Hollywood Records]]' [[Plain White T's]] ''[[Rhythm of Love (Plain White T's song)|Rhythm of Love]]''.{{cite web | url=http://www.today3d.com/2011/01/plain-white-ts-smash-hit-rhythm-of-love.html | title=Plain White T's Smash Hit ''Rhythm of Love'' now in 3D with PassmoreLab | publisher=Today 3D | date=January 20, 2011 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} PassmoreLab also became the first content provider to broadcast a 3D title, by sharing [[Slash (musician)|Slash]]’s ''[[By the Sword (song)|By the Sword]]'' music video on [[Rogers Communications]] [[3DTV]] Cable Channel, and announced their partnership with Feodor Pitcairn Productions to create ''Ocean Voyagers in 3D''.{{cite web | url=http://www.today3d.com/2010/11/ocean-voyagers-producers-team-with.html | title=''Ocean Voyagers'' producers team with PassmoreLab to bring 3D version to life | publisher=Today 3D | date=November 22, 2011 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} Passmore film ''Night of the Living Dead, Now in 3D!'' began its theatrical run with [[National Amusements]] in the [[US]] and [[UK]]. The lab's film ''The Extreme Nature of Bats'' won the award for 'Best Short Documentary' at the Arizona Underground Film Festival and the award for 'Best Cinematography' at the Dark Carnival Film Festival in [[Bloomington, Illinois]], and premiered in [[Transylvania]] on [[Halloween]] as a moving theatre ride. PassmoreLab also completed 3D production on [[Ed Wood]]'s [[horror film]] ''[[Plan 9 from Outer Space]]'', and presented ''Night of the Living Dead in 3D''.{{cite web | url=http://scifipulse.net/?tag=passmorelab | title=Biggest ZOMBIE Movie of All Time Sets 3D Premiere at Legendary Rocker Johnny Ramone’s Memorial Tribute | publisher=scifipulse.net | date=August 22, 2009 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=Ian Cullen}} 2010 also had PassmoreLab signing a $200 million 3D conversion deal with [[Grizzly Adams Productions]],{{cite web |url=http://www.ncbr.com/article.asp?id=51689 |title=Grizzly Adams Signs $200 Million 3D Conversion Deal |publisher=Northern Colorado Business Report |date= 20 May 2010}} completing their tutorial video ''Shooting 3D'' for beginner filmmakers,{{cite web | url=http://www.mtbs3d.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=10453:PassmoreLab-s-New-Tutorial-Video----Shooting-3D-&catid=44:newswires&Itemid=89 | title=PassmoreLab`s New Tutorial Video - `Shooting 3D` | publisher=mtbs3d.com | date=November 7, 2009 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=Pam Swartz}} premiering ''Physics of Surfing'' at the 3D Film Festival in Hollywood,{{cite web | url=http://la3dclub.com/1219-8pm-3-d-movie-night-passmorelab-3-d-documentaries/ | title=12/19 8pm 3-D Movie Night – PassmoreLab 3-D Documentaries | publisher=LA 3D Club | date=December 3, 2010 | accessdate=July 3, 2011 | author=Eric Kurland}} and selling ''Microworlds'' to [[Discovery Channel]] [[3D television|3D]]. In 2011, PassmoreLab announced a 2-Year content licensing deal with [[NVIDIA]] for new web-based content portal deliver.{{cite web | url=http://exploreworldtv.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=274:passmorelabs-3d-content-now-mobile-on-spatial-views-3deecentralcom&catid=27:technology&Itemid=30 | title=PassmoreLab’s Acclaimed 3D Films Coming to NVIDIA’s 3DVisionLive.com | work=Explore World TV | date=March 1, 2011 | accessdate=July 1, 2011 | author=Cadulla, Al}} In March 2011, the company debuted their 3D music videos and science adventure content at [[CeBIT|CeBIT Live]] in [[Hannover, Germany]], and ''Plan 9 from Outer Space, Now in 3D!'' premiered at the [[Cinequest Film Festival]] in [[San Jose, California|San Jose]].{{cite web | url=http://www.cinequest.org/detail.php?m=3244 | title=PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE, NOW IN 3D! | publisher=[[Cinequest Film Festival]] | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} In May 2011, PassmoreLab announced conversion of the ''[[Starfish Cove]]'' animated series{{cite web | url=http://www.stereoscopynews.com/hotnews/3d-technology/2d-to-3d-conversion/1547-passmorelab-.html | title=PassmoreLab is converting the Starfish Cove animated series to 3D | publisher=stereoscopynews.com | date=May 19, 2011 | accessdate=July 3, 2011}} and in June the company finished conversion of Feodor Pitcairn’s ''[[Ocean Voyagers]]'', and Linkin Park’s ''[[Transformers: Dark of the Moon]]'' theme song, "''Iridescent''", which has screened in select theaters nationwide.{{cite web | url = http://indiefilm3d.com/linkin-parkʼs-iridescent-screen-3d-theatres-worldwide | title=Linkin Park's Iridescent to Screen in 3D at Theatres Worldwide | publisher=[[IndieFilm3D]] | author=Dager, Nick}} In July 2011, [[Nintendo]] premiered PassmoreLab's 3D animated short film, "Sunday Jog", as part of an initiative to help launch the [[Nintendo 3DS|Nintendo 3DS']] 3D streaming service, Nintendo Video.{{cite web | url = https://www.nintendo.com/3ds/nintendo-video/detail/yJiLiMwH-D6jOowOgQtUj3DUKglMEbwE | title = Sunday Jog | publisher = Nintendo | date = July 21, 2011}} Also in July, Passmorelab, in conjunction with The Collective,{{cite web | url = http://www.thecollective-la.com/ | title = The Collective}} converted Memphis High's{{cite web | url = http://memphishigh.net | title = Memphis High}} latest music video, ''Criminal Love'', into 3D.{{cite web | url = http://www.thejonasbrotherssite.com/news/article/4f7a818e73dfc155d853f3bdfae9848d/PassmoreLab+Adds+3D+to+Pop+Sensation+Memphis+Highʼs+Hit+Song+Criminal+Love | title = PassmoreLab Adds 3D to Pop Sensation Memphis High's Hit Song Criminal Love. | publisher = The Jonas Brothers | date = July 31, 2011}} In 2012, the company completed a 3D production titled ''Flower Power'',{{cite web | url = http://www.3dfocus.co.uk/miptv-3d/passmorelab-announce-new-thought-provoking-3d-documentaries/7902 | title = PassmoreLab announce new thought provoking 3D documentaries | publisher = 3D Focus | date = Sep 21, 2012}} it converted the film Fighter Pilot to 3D and released the film ''Fighter Pilot 3D'' at the Museum of Flight in Seattle, WA,{{cite web | url = http://www.museumofflight.org/event/2013/jul/06/fighter-pilot-3d-opens-july-6 | title = Fighter Pilot 3D Opens July 6! | publisher = http://www.museumofflight.org/}} and began work on a 3D series titled ''Glimpse 3D''.{{cite web | url = http://www.prweb.com/releases/2012/9/prweb9922550.htm | title = Passmorelab Completes Pilot Episode of New 3D TV Series GLIMPSE 3D | publisher = PR Web | date = March 30, 2012}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.passmorelab.com/}} [[Category:Film distributors of the United States]] [[Category:Film production companies of the United States]] [[Category:Special effects companies]] [[Category:3D cinema]]

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/RDX451|RDX451]] ([[User talk:RDX451|talk]]) to last version by KolbertBot
revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=April 2009}} {{see also|Political theatre}} A '''political drama''' can describe a [[Theatre|play]], [[film]] or [[TV program]] that has a [[politics|political]] component, whether reflecting the author's political opinion, or describing a [[politician]] or series of political events.
[[Dramatist]]s who have written political dramas include [[Aaron Sorkin]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0815070/bio|title=Aaron Sorkin|website=IMDb|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.tvguide.com/news/dramatist-aaron-sorkin-1012873/|title=The Dramatist: How Aaron Sorkin Made Politics Entertaining|date=2009-12-07|work=TVGuide.com|access-date=2017-07-04|language=en}}</ref>, [[Robert Penn Warren]], [[Sergei Eisenstein]], [[Bertolt Brecht]], [[Jean-Paul Sartre]], [[Caryl Churchill]], and [[Federico García Lorca]].
==Television== [[Television series]] that have been classified as political dramas include ''[[The West Wing (TV series)|The West Wing]]'', ''[[Borgen (TV series)|Borgen]]'', ''[[Boss (TV series)|Boss]]'', ''[[Jack and Bobby]]'', ''[[The Bold Ones: The Senator]]'', ''[[Commander in Chief (TV series)|Commander in Chief]]'', ''House of Cards'' ([[House of Cards (UK TV series)|UK]] and [[House of Cards (US TV series)|US]] versions), ''[[Madam Secretary (TV series)|Madam Secretary]]'' and ''[[Designated Survivor (TV series)|Designated Survivor]]''.
''[[The Good Wife]]'' can also be considered a political drama, especially in its critically acclaimed [[The Good Wife (season 2)|second season]] and [[The Good Wife (season 5)|fifth season]]. Races for political office, including [[state's attorney]], [[Governor (United States)|governor]], and even a Presidential run, move in and out of the show's narrative and the story of its main character, Alicia Florrick. However, Alicia's primary profession as a litigator for the most part takes precedence in the narrative, and so the show more often focuses on her cases and related office politics, making it primarily a [[legal drama]].{{Citation needed|date=July 2017}}
==Film== There have been notables films that have been labeled as political dramas such as ''[[Thirteen Days (film)|Thirteen Days]]''. A famous literary political drama which later made the transition to film was Robert Penn Warren's ''[[All the King's Men]]''.
==References== <references />
[[Category:Political drama| ]] [[Category:Works about politics|Drama]] [[Category:Television genres]]

{{use dmy dates|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox amusement park | image = Pripyat_ferris_wheel_side.jpg | caption =The Ferris Wheel, August 2016 | location = [[Pripyat]], [[Ukraine]] | opening_date = 1986 | closing_date = 1986 | reopening_date = | previous_names = | theme = | season = | area = | rides = 5 | coasters = | water_rides = | owner = | slogan = | homepage = | cooridinates = }} [[File:Pripyat amusement park Bumper cars.jpg|thumb|The bumper cars in 2016]] The '''Pripyat amusement park''' is an [[abandonment (legal)|abandoned]] [[amusement park]] located in [[Pripyat]], [[Ukraine]]. It was to be opened for the first time on 1 May 1986, in time for the [[International Workers' Day|May Day]] celebrations,{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/04/17/pripyat-chernobyl-30th-anniversary/82897578/|title=Pillaged and peeling, radiation-ravaged Pripyat welcomes 'extreme' tourists|newspaper=USA Today}}{{cite web|author=Pacific Standard |url=https://psmag.com/chernobyl-in-spring-c02246829e3c#.kjqfe07e7 |title=Chernobyl in Spring — Pacific Standard |publisher=Psmag.com |date= |accessdate=2016-06-16}} but these plans were cancelled on 26 April, when the [[Chernobyl disaster]] occurred a few kilometers away. Several sources report that the park was opened for a short time on 27 April before the announcement to evacuate the city was made,{{cite book|url= |title=Bioterrorism with CD-ROM: Psychological and Public Health Interventions|authors=Robert J. Ursano, Ann E. Norwood, Carol S. Fullerton|publisher=Cambridge University Press |date=17 June 2004 |accessdate=2016-06-16 |page=175}}{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ShFSAAAAMAAJ|title=The International Chernobyl Project: an overview : assessment of radiological consequences and evaluation of protective measures|author=International Atomic Energy|last=|date=1991|publisher=IAEA|page=49}}{{cite web|url=http://www.9news.com.au/world/2016/04/12/13/53/chernobyl-disaster-zone-top-pick-for-extreme-tourists-30-years-on|title=Chernobyl disaster zone top pick for 'extreme tourists' 30 years on|author=|date=|publisher=|accessdate=16 June 2016}} and one site shows photos of the amusement park in operation.[http://www.grahamgilmore.com/chernobyl/ Article on Chernobyl by Graham Gilmore] showing photos of the amusement park in operation Theories that the park was hurriedly opened in the aftermath of the accident to distract Pripyat residents from the unfolding disaster nearby seem to be substantiated by the fact that some of the rides were never fully completed (the [[paratrooper (ride)|Paratrooper]] was not fitted with canopies and the Ferris wheel's cladding was incomplete[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VPo9-cpsuQE YouTube video] taken shortly after evacuation in 1986. Retrieved 1 November 2017.). In any case, the park—and its [[Ferris wheel]] in particular—have become a symbol of the Chernobyl disaster.{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=aJhKAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA226|title=Why We Need Nuclear Power: The Environmental Case|first=Michael H.|last=Fox|date=2014|publisher=OUP USA|page=226}} == Attractions == Constructed under the [[Soviet Union]] as a "[[:ru:Парк культуры и отдыха|Парк культуры и отдыха]]" (Park of Culture and Rest) typical of many large cities in the then Soviet Union, the amusement park's attractions were manufactured by the [[Yeysk]]-based firm "[[:ru:Аттракцион (завод)|Аттракцион]]" (Attraction), who were responsible for the construction of many of the amusement parks which remain to be seen around the former Soviet Union today in various states of repair.{{cite web|url=https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Аттракцион_(завод)|title=Аттракцион (завод)|author=|date=|work=|accessdate=31 October 2017}}{{Better source|reason=per WP:CIRCULAR|date=December 2017}} Located north-west to the Palace of Culture in the center of Pripyat, the park had five attractions: * The iconic 26m [[Ferris wheel]] "Круговой обзор" ('Circular Overview') * [[Bumper cars]] "Автодром" ('Autodrome') * [[paratrooper (ride)|Paratrooper ride]] "Ромашка" ('Chamomile') * [[Swing boats]] "Русские качели" ('Russian Swing') * The park also contains a carnival shooting game{{citation needed|date=October 2015}}
The successor to the original company are still manufacturing the Ferris wheel, paratrooper and bumper cars to largely unaltered designs as of 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.attractions.ru|title=Аттракцион - Инвест: аттракционы.|author=|date=|work=|accessdate=31 October 2017}} == Radiation == Radiation levels around the park vary. The liquidators washed radiation into the soil after the helicopters carrying radioactive materials used the grounds as a landing strip, so concreted areas are relatively safe. However, areas where moss has built can emit up to 25000 µSv/h, among the highest level of radiation in the whole of Pripyat.[http://www.grahamgilmore.com/chernobyl/ Article on Chernobyl by Graham Gilmore]. Retrieved 31 October 2017. == Films, games, media and literature == The park plays significant roles in the video games ''[[S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl]]'' and ''[[Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare]]'', and the film ''[[Chernobyl Diaries]]''. The park plays significant roles too in the [[Markiyan Kamysh]] novel about [[Disaster tourism|Chernobyl illegal trips]], ''A Stroll to the Zone''. The Ferris wheel made news in September 2017 when Polish tourists turned it mechanically for the first time since 1986, later returning it to its original position.{{cite web|url=https://tsn.ua/video/video-novini/v-pokinutiy-prip-yati-bilya-chornobilya-zapustili-koleso-oglyadu.html|title=В покинутій Прип'яті біля Чорнобиля запустили колесо огляду|author=|date=14 September 2017|publisher=TCH|accessdate=31 October 2017}} The park appeared in [[Suede (band)|Suede]]'s music video clip, "[[The Blue Hour (album)|Life Is Golden]]". == References == [[File:Pripyat amusement park Paratrooper.jpg|thumb|The paratrooper in 2016]] {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Amusement park in Pripyat}} * [http://www.grahamgilmore.com//portfolio/chernobyl/ Graham Gilmore Photography | Chernobyl Exclusion Zone] * [http://www.tiedto111.com/locations/pripyat-ferris-wheel-chernobyl/ Abseiling The ferris Wheel In Pripyat] * [https://maps.google.com/maps?ll=51.408139,30.055643&z=18&t=m&hl=en-US Satellite photo of Pripyat ferris wheel], Google Maps {{Chernobyl disaster}} {{coord|51|24|29.28|N|30|3|25.65|E|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pripyat Amusement Park}} [[Category:1986 establishments in Ukraine]] [[Category:1986 disestablishments in Ukraine]] [[Category:Pripyat|Amusement Park]] [[Category:Chernobyl Exclusion Zone]] [[Category:Defunct amusement parks]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Kiev Oblast]] [[Category:Abandoned amusement parks]] [[Category:Amusement parks opened in 1986]] [[Category:Amusement parks closed in 1986]] {{Ukraine-struct-stub}} {{amusement-park-stub}}

revision.comment: Undid revision 854798619 by [[Special:Contributions/LorenMeta|LorenMeta]] ([[User talk:LorenMeta|talk]]) is that what the reference says?
revision.text:
{{distinguish|psychosurgery}} {{Paranormal}} {{alternative medical systems}} [[file:Gutierrez3.jpg|thumb|An alleged psychic surgeon at work.]] '''Psychic surgery''' is a [[pseudoscience|pseudoscientific]] [[medical fraud]] in which the practitioner creates the [[Magic (illusion)|illusion]] of performing surgery with his or her bare hands and uses [[trickery]], fake blood, and animal parts to convince the patient that the diseased lesions have been removed and that the incision has spontaneously healed.{{Cite web|url=https://www.ftc.gov/sites/default/files/documents/commission_decision_volumes/volume-86/ftc_volume_decision_86_july_-_december_1975pages_715-825.pdf|title=FTC Decision, Volume 86, July–December 1975|last=|first=|date=|work=|format=|accessdate=2017-08-11}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1975/10/25/archives/ftc-curtails-the-promotion-of-all-psychic-surgery-tours.html |title=F.T.C. Curtails the Promotion Of All Psychic Surgery Tours - The New York Times |accessdate=2007-08-19 |format= |work= | date=1975-10-25}}{{Cite journal|title=Psychic surgery |journal=CA: A Cancer Journal for Clinicians |volume=40 |issue=3 |pages=184–8 |year=1990 | url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.3322/canjclin.40.3.184/abstract | pmid=2110023 | accessdate=2007-08-19 |doi=10.3322/canjclin.40.3.184 }} It has been denounced by the [[United States|US]] [[Federal Trade Commission]] as a "total hoax", and the [[American Cancer Society]] maintains that psychic surgery may cause needless death by keeping the ill away from life-saving medical care. Medical professionals and skeptics classify it as [[sleight of hand]] and any positive results as a [[placebo effect]].{{Cite book| last = Randi | first = James | authorlink = James Randi | year = 1989 | title = [[The Faith Healers]] | publisher = Prometheus Books | isbn = 0-87975-535-0 }}David Vernon in ''Skeptical - a Handbook of Pseudoscience and the Paranormal'', ed [[Donald Laycock]], [[David Vernon (writer)|David Vernon]], [[Colin Groves]], [[Simon Brown (author)|Simon Brown]], Imagecraft, Canberra, 1989, {{ISBN|0-7316-5794-2}}, p47{{Cite book | last = Evan | first = Dylan | title = Placebo. Mind over matter in modern medicine. | publisher = Harper Collins Publishers | year = 2003 | location = Great Britain | isbn = 0-00-712613-1 }}{{Cite book | last = Brody | first = Howard M.D. PhD | title = The Placebo response | publisher = Harper Collins Publishers | year = 2000 | location = New York | isbn = 0-06-019493-6 }} It first appeared in the [[Spiritualism|Spiritualist]] communities of the [[Philippines]] and [[Brazil]] in the middle of the 20th century, and it has taken different paths in those two countries.[[Terence Hines|Hines, Terence]]. (1988). ''Pseudoscience and the Paranormal: A Critical Examination of the Evidence''. Prometheus Books. p. 245. {{ISBN|0-87975-419-2}} ==Procedure== Although psychic surgery varies by region and practitioner, it usually follows some common lines. Without the use of a surgical instrument, a practitioner will press the tips of his/her fingers against the patient's skin in the area to be treated. The practitioner's hands appear to penetrate into the patient's body painlessly and blood seems to flow. The practitioner will then show organic matter or foreign objects apparently removed from the patient's body, clean the area, and then end the procedure with the patient's skin showing no wounds or scars. Most cases do not involve actual surgery although some practitioners make real incisions.{{Cite book| last = Spence| first = Lewis | title = Encyclopedia of Occultism & Parapsychology Vol. 2| publisher = Kessinger Publishing Co| year = 2003| pages = 750| isbn = 978-0-7661-2817-0}} In regions of the world where belief in evil spirits is prevalent, practitioners will sometimes exhibit objects, such as glass, explaining that the foreign bodies were placed in the patient's body by evil spirits. ==History== Accounts of [[psychic]] surgery started to appear in the [[Spiritualism|Spiritualist]] communities of the [[Philippines]] and [[Brazil]] in the mid-1900s.[[Nevill Drury|Drury, Nevill]]. (2002). ''The Dictionary of the Esoteric: Over 3000 Entries on the Mystical and Occult Traditions''. Watkins Publishing. p. 259. {{ISBN|1-84293-041-9}} ===Philippines=== In the [[Philippines]], the procedure was first noticed in the 1940s, when performed routinely by [[Eleuterio Terte]]. Terte and his pupil [[Tony Agpaoa]], who was apparently associated with the ''[[Union Espiritista Christiana de Filipinas]]'' (The Christian Spiritist Union of the Philippines), trained others in this procedure. In 1959, the procedure came to the attention of the U. S. public after the publication of ''[[Into the Strange Unknown]]'' by [[Ron Ormond]] and [[Ormond McGill]]. The authors called the practice "[[Four-dimensional space|fourth dimension]]al surgery," and wrote "[we] still don’t know what to think; but we have motion pictures to show it wasn’t the work of any normal magician, and could very well be just what the Filipinos said it was — a miracle of God performed by a fourth dimensional surgeon."{{Cite book | last = | first = | authorlink = |author2=Ormond, Ron |author3=McGill, Ormand | title = Into the Strange Unknown By the Two Men Who Lived Every Moment of it | publisher = The Esoteric Foundation | year = 1959 | location = | pages = | url = http://www.biblio.com/details.php?dcx=134022077&aid=frg | doi = | id = | isbn = 0-87975-535-0 | author = James Randi ; foreword by Carl Sagan.}} In "...1973, a group of medical doctors, scientists, and parapsychologists visited the Philippine Islands to study a phenomenon that was causing increased furor amongst health professionals ... Filipino psychic surgeons, also known as spiritual/magnetic healers."{{cite journal|last1=Allison|first1=Stephen H.|last2=Malony|first2=H. Newton|title=Filipino Psychic Surgery: Myth, Magic, or Miracle|journal=Journal of Religion and Health|date=Spring 1981|volume=20|issue=1|pages=48–62|jstor=27505608|accessdate=|publisher=Springer|doi=10.1007/bf01533287}} [[Alex Orbito]], who became well known in the United States through his association with actress [[Shirley MacLaine]]{{Cite web|title=Filipino psychic takes Indians for a ride - By N. Bhanutej|publisher=The Week (India)|date=September 8, 2002|accessdate=August 19, 2007}} was one said practitioner of the procedure. On June 14, 2005, Orbito was arrested by Canadian authorities and indicted for fraud.{{Cite web|url=http://www.filipinoreporter.com/archive/3327/headline03.htm |title=The Filipino Reporter |accessdate=2007-08-19 |work=}} On Jan 20, 2006, the charges were dropped as it then seemed unlikely that Orbito would be convicted.{{Cite web|url=http://www.filipinoreporter.com/archive/3424/headline05.htm |title=The Filipino Reporter |accessdate=2007-08-19 |work=}} Psychic surgery made U.S. [[Tabloid journalism|tabloid]] headlines in March 1984 when entertainer [[Andy Kaufman]], diagnosed with [[large cell]] [[carcinoma]] (a rare [[lung cancer]]), traveled to the Philippines for a six-week course of psychic surgery.{{Cite web|url=http://www.benatural.org/psychic-surgery.html |title= Psychic Surgery |accessdate=2007-08-19 |work=}} Practitioner Jun Labo claimed to have removed large cancerous tumors and Kaufman declared he believed this cancer had been removed.[[Martin Gardner|Gardner, Martin]]. (2000). ''From the Wandering Jew to William F. Buckley Jr: On Science, Literature, and Religion''. Prometheus Books. pp. 32-33 Kaufman died from renal failure as consequence of a [[metastasis|metastatic]] lung cancer, on May 16, 1984.[http://vitals.rootsweb.com/ca/death/search.cgi California Death Index] ===Brazil=== The origins of the practice in [[Brazil]] are obscure; but by the late 1950s "[[Energy medicine|spiritual healers]]" were practicing in the country. Many of them were associated with [[Spiritism]], a major [[spiritualism|spiritualistic]] movement in [[Brazil]] and claimed to be performing their operations merely as [[Mediumship|channels]] for spirits of deceased medical doctors.Stemman, Roy. (1976). ''The Supernatural''. Danbury Press. p. 118 A known Brazilian psychic healer who routinely practiced psychic surgery was [[Zé Arigó]], who claimed to be channeling for a deceased medical doctor of name [[Dr. Fritz]]. Unlike most other psychic healers, who work bare-handed, Arigó used a non-surgical blade.{{Cite web|url=http://www.randi.org/encyclopedia/Arigo,%20Jose.html |archive-url=http://arquivo.pt/wayback/20090711050748/http://www.randi.org/encyclopedia/Arigo,%20Jose.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2009-07-11 |title=James Randi Educational Foundation — Arigó, José |accessdate=2007-08-19 |work= }} Other psychic healers who claimed to channel for Dr. Fritz were [[Edson Queiroz]] and [[Rubens Farias Jr.]].{{Cite news|url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9A07E1DD1039F931A25752C0A960958260&sec=health&spon=&pagewanted=all |title=Rio Journal;Live, in Brazil (Again): The Reincarnated Dr. Fritz - New York Times |accessdate=2007-08-19 |format= |work=The New York Times | date=1996-01-12}} Popular today (especially abroad) is João de Faria, also known as [[João de Deus (medium)|João de Deus]], a [[Quackery|quack]] operating in [[Abadiânia]], state of [[Goiás]].{{Cite web|url=http://skepdic.com/johnofgod.html |title=John of God |accessdate=2007-08-19 |work=}} According to the descriptions of [[BDORT|Yoshiaki Omura]], Brazilian psychic surgery appears to be different from that practiced in the Philippines. Omura calls attention to the fact that practitioners in Brazil use techniques resembling [[Qigong]], [[Shiatsu]] massage, and [[chiropractic]] manipulation. Some patients are also injected with a brown liquid, and alleged minor surgery was performed in about 20% of the cases observed.Omura Y. Impression on observing psychic surgery and healing in Brazil which appear to incorporate (+) qi gong energy & the use of acupuncture points. [[Acupunct Electrother Res]] 1997;22(1):17-33. {{PMID|9188913}} While Arigó performed his procedures using kitchen knives in improvised settings, Omura reports that the clamping of blood vessels and the closing of the surgical wounds are now performed by licensed surgeons or licensed nurses.{{Cite web|url=http://www.aegis.com/aidsline/1997/oct/M97A0099.html |title=Yoshiaki Omura on psychic surgery in Brazil |accessdate=2007-08-19 |work=}} ===North America=== In the 1970s a specific form of surgery known as psychic dentistry emerged in America. [[Willard Fuller]] was the most well known proponent. It was alleged that Fuller could cause [[Dental restoration|dental filling]]s to appear spontaneously, change silver into golden fillings, straighten crooked teeth or produce new teeth. However, [[Magic (illusion)|magicians]] and skeptics have found these claims to be unsupported by solid evidence. One dentist examined some patients of Fuller. In one case miraculous gold fillings turned out to be [[tobacco]] stains. In another case a female patient who reported a miraculous new silver filling admitted she had forgotten that the filling was already there.Nickell, Joe. (1993). ''Looking for a Miracle: Weeping Icons, Relics, Stigmata, Visions & Healing Cures''. Prometheus Books. pp. 141-142. {{ISBN|1-57392-680-9}}Butler, Kurt. (1999). ''Lying for Fun and Profit: The Truth about the Media : Exposes the Corrupt Symbiosis Between Media Giants and the Health Fraud Industries''. Health Wise Productions. pp. 100-101. {{ISBN|978-0967328102}} ==Medical and legal criticism== In 1975, the [[Federal Trade Commission]] declared that "'psychic surgery' "is nothing but a total [[hoax]]"." Judge Daniel H. Hanscom, when granting the FTC an injunction against travel agencies promoting psychic surgery tours, declared: "Psychic surgery is pure and unmitigated fakery. The 'surgical operations' of psychic surgeons ... with their bare hands are simply phony.""F.T.C. Curbs Philippines Flights For Cures by 'Psychic Surgery'"; New York Times March 15, 1975, p. 11 (Judge Hanscom: "pure and unmitigated fakery... simply phony") In 1975 the FTC stated:
It has been found that "psychic surgery" is pure fakery. The body is not opened, no "surgery" is performed with the bare hands or with anything else, and nothing is removed from the body. The entire "operation" is an egregious fraud perpetrated by sleight-of-hand and similar tricks and devices.{{Cite web|url=https://www.ftc.gov/sites/default/files/documents/commission_decision_volumes/volume-86/ftc_volume_decision_86_july_-_december_1975pages_715-825.pdf#page=43|title=Federal Trade Commission Decisions, Volume 86, 1975, p. 757|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=2017-08-11}}
In 1990, the [[American Cancer Society]] stated that it "found no evidence that "psychic surgery" results in objective benefit in the treatment of any medical condition," and strongly urged individuals who are ill not to seek treatment by psychic surgery. The [[BC Cancer Agency|British Columbia Cancer Agency]] "strongly urges individuals who are ill not to seek treatment by psychic surgeon."{{Cite news|url=http://www.bccancer.bc.ca/PPI/UnconventionalTherapies/PsychicSurgery.htm |title=Unconventional therapies--Psychic surgery |publisher=British Columbia Cancer Agency |date=February 2000 |first= |last= |accessdate=2007-04-01 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070202112741/http://www.bccancer.bc.ca/PPI/UnconventionalTherapies/PsychicSurgery.htm |archivedate=2007-02-02 |deadurl=yes |df= }} While not directly hazardous to the patient, the belief in the alleged benefits of psychic surgery may carry considerable risk for individuals with diagnosed medical conditions, as they may delay or forgo conventional medical help, sometimes with fatal consequences.{{Cite web|url=http://www.ncahf.org/pp/faith.html |title=NCAHF Statements on Faith Healing and Psychic Surgery |accessdate=2007-08-19 |work=}} ==Accusations of fraud== The physician [[William A. Nolen|William Nolen]] investigated psychic surgery and his book ''Healing: A Doctor in Search of a Miracle'' (1974) uncovered many cases of fraud.[[William A. Nolen|Nolen, William]]. (1974). ''Healing: A Doctor in Search of a Miracle''. New York: Random House. {{ISBN|0-394-49095-9}} [[Tony Agpaoa]] a famous psychic surgeon was several times detected in trickery.Neher, Andrew. (2011). ''Paranormal and Transcendental Experience: A Psychological Examination''. Dover Publications. p. 171. {{ISBN|0-486-26167-0}} Stage magician [[James Randi]] says psychic surgery is a [[sleight of hand]] confidence trick. He has said that in personal observations of the procedure, and in movies showing the procedures, he can spot sleight-of-hand moves that are evident to experienced stage magicians, but might deceive a casual observer. Randi has replicated the appearance of psychic surgery himself through the use of sleight-of-hand.[[James Randi|Randi, James]]. (1982). ''[[Flim-Flam! Psychics, ESP, Unicorns, and Other Delusions]]''. Prometheus Books. {{ISBN|0-87975-198-3}}[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u14JFjF9jBg James Randi Replicating Psychic Surgery] Professional magician [[Milbourne Christopher]] also investigated psychic surgeons at work, and observed sleight of hand.[[Milbourne Christopher|Christopher, Milbourne]]. (1975). ''Mediums, Mystics & the Occult''. Thomas Y. Crowell. {{ISBN|0-690-00476-1}} On his A&E show ''[[Criss Angel Mindfreak|Mindfreak]]'' in the episode "Sucker," illusionist [[Criss Angel]] performed "Psychic Surgery," showing first-hand how it may be done (fake blood, plastic bags and chicken livers were used). Randi says the healer would slightly roll or pinch the skin over the area to be treated. When his flattened hand reaches under the roll of skin, it looks and feels as if the practitioner is actually entering into the patient's body. The healer would have prepared in advance small pellets or bags of animal entrails which would be palmed in his hand or hidden beneath the table within easy reach. This organic matter would simulate the "diseased" tissue that the healer would claim to be removing. If the healer wants to simulate bleeding, he might squeeze a bladder of animal blood or an impregnated sponge. If done properly, this procedure may deceive patients and observers. However, some "psychic surgery" procedures do not rely solely on the "sleight of hand" described, as at least one [[João de Deus (medium)|Brazilian "surgeon"]] also cuts his victims' skin with an unsterilized scalpel to heighten the illusion.[[James Randi|Randi, James]]. (1995). [http://randi.org/encyclopedia/psychic%20surgery.html ''Psychic surgery''] in ''[[An Encyclopedia of Claims, Frauds, and Hoaxes of the Occult and Supernatural]]''. St. Martin's Press. {{ISBN|0-312-15119-5}} [[John G. Taylor|John Taylor]] has written there is no real case for psychic surgery as the explanation of fraud is highly likely in all the operations.[[John G. Taylor|Taylor, John]]. (1980). ''Science and the Supernatural: An Investigation of Paranormal Phenomena Including Psychic Healing, Clairvoyance, Telepathy, and Precognition by a Distinguished Physicist and Mathematician''. Temple Smith. pp. 31-36. {{ISBN|0-85117-191-5}} The practitioners use [[sleight of hand]] techniques to produce [[blood]] or blood-like fluids, animal [[Tissue (biology)|tissue]] or substitutes, and/or various foreign objects from folds of skin of the patient as part of a [[confidence trick]] for financial benefit. Science writer [[Terence Hines]] has written:
The "operation" starts as the hand appears to enter the patient’s belly. This is accomplished by creating an impression in the belly by pushing down and flexing the fingers slowly into a fist—the fingers thus appear to be moving into the belly, but are really simply hidden behind the hand. The blood that further disguises the true movement of the fingers and adds drama to the proceedings can come from two sources. One is a fake thumb, worn over the real thumb and filled with a red liquid. Such a fake thumb is a common magician’s implement. Blood can also be passed to the surgeon in red balloons hidden in cotton the psychic surgeon is using, the cotton and its hidden contents being passed to him by an "assistant." The bits of “tumor” can also be passed to the psychic surgeon this way, or hidden in the false thumb... the "tumor" material turns out to be chicken intestines or similar animal remains. The blood is either animal blood or red dye.
Two "psychic surgeons" provided testimony in a [[Federal Trade Commission]] trial that, to their knowledge, the organic matter supposedly removed from the patients usually consists of animal tissue and clotted blood. ==In popular culture== [[File:James_Randi_demonstrating_'psychic_surgery'_on_ITV_series_"James_Randi,_Psychic_Investigator".jpg|thumb|right|[[James Randi]] using sleight of hand to duplicate “psychic surgery” on his [[Open Media]] series for [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] in 1991]] *In the 1989 film ''[[Penn & Teller Get Killed]]'', comedic magicians [[Penn and Teller]] demonstrate how to perform the illusion of psychic surgery. *A 1989 episode of ''[[Unsolved Mysteries]]'' featured a police officer whose mother claimed to have been cured by psychic surgery, only to die shortly thereafter; her autopsy revealed several tumors. The policeman described himself going undercover to feign illness and pretended to desire psychic surgery, having the feeling of the practitioner using sleight of hand to supposedly dig into his tissue, as well as suspecting that the "cysts" and "tumors" being removed from his body were actually ready-made chicken parts. *In the TV show ''[[Criss Angel Mindfreak]]'', Season 2 Episode "Sucker", Criss explains psychic surgery as a deception. *In the 1999 movie ''[[Man on the Moon (film)|Man on the Moon]]'', a movie based on the life of [[Andy Kaufman]], Kaufman receives psychic surgery and notices the "sleight of hand". He is next seen dead, with his funeral being conducted. *In the television show ''[[1000 Ways to Die]]'', a con artist was using this to scam poor country people, only to lead to his death when he used it on a [[leper]] from whom he caught the disease. *[[Milagro (The X-Files)|"Milagro"]], a sixth season episode from ''[[The X-Files]]'', features a killer accused of using psychic surgery on his victims, killing them in the process. *In the TV series ''[[Angel (1999 TV series)|Angel]]'', Season 1 episode "[[I Fall to Pieces (Angel)]]" features a doctor who practices psychic surgery. *In the [[BBC]] TV series ''[[Full Circle with Michael Palin]]'', [[Michael Palin]] witnesses two separate instances of psychic surgery in the [[Baguio]] district of the Philippines. On raising his suspicion with the medic that it seemed a sleight of hand to him, the medic told him he was a westerner and could only understand the surgery if he had a [[third eye]].
