Palin assists another medic in a surgery and was told that no contamination happens in this procedure because of the use of [[garlic]]. *In the 1998 Christmas Special of the [[BBC1]] series ''[[Jonathan Creek]]'', entitled "[[List of Jonathan Creek episodes#Christmas Special .281998.29|Black Canary]]", the husband of the illusionist known as Black Canary undergoes psychic surgery at the start of the episode and this form of surgery forms a plot device throughout the special. *In a deleted scene from the 2016 movie ''[[Deadpool (film)|Deadpool]]'', Wade Wilson ([[Ryan Reynolds]]) visits a psychic surgery clinic in an attempt to cure his cancer, but upon realizing the clinic is scamming innocent clients into spending their life-savings on simple sleight of hand, he attacks and murders the head surgeon in front of the staff. ==See also== *[[Faith healing]] *[[Health fraud]] *[[Alternative cancer treatments]] *[[List of topics characterized as pseudoscience]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==Further reading== *[[Henry Gordon (magician)|Gordon, Henry]]. (1988). ''Extrasensory Deception: ESP, Psychics, Shirley MacLaine, Ghosts, UFOs''. Macmillan of Canada. {{ISBN|0-7715-9539-5}} *[[William A. Nolen|Nolen, William]]. (1974). ''Healing: A Doctor in Search of a Miracle''. New York: Random House. {{ISBN|0-394-49095-9}} *[[James Randi|Randi, James]]. (1982). ''[[Flim-Flam! Psychics, ESP, Unicorns, and Other Delusions]]''. Prometheus Books. {{ISBN|0-87975-198-3}} *[[John G. Taylor|Taylor, John]]. (1980). ''Science and the Supernatural: An Investigation of Paranormal Phenomena Including Psychic Healing, Clairvoyance, Telepathy, and Precognition by a Distinguished Physicist and Mathematician''. Temple Smith. {{ISBN|0-85117-191-5}} ==External links== * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sxMGxz6-oTs James Randi debunks "psychic surgery"] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vuwMhDkd6Qo Turkish Television] [[Brian Brushwood]] debunks psychic surgery * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070202112741/http://www.bccancer.bc.ca/PPI/UnconventionalTherapies/PsychicSurgery.htm Unconventional therapies - Psychic Surgery] — overview by the [[British Columbia Cancer Agency]] * [http://skepdic.com/psurgery.html Psychic "surgery"] — definition in the [[Skeptic's Dictionary]] * [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/query.fcgi?cmd=Retrieve&db=PubMed&list_uids=9188913&dopt=Abstract Abstract] * "Psychic Surgery" (1990) ''Ca. Cancer J. Clin.'' 40(3) 184-8 [http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.3322/canjclin.40.3.184/abstract] [http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.3322/canjclin.40.3.184/pdf] Terte/Agpaoa origins; exposed by Milbourne Christopher and Robert Gurtler. * "Sideshows of Science," David Perlman, San Francisco Chronicle, January 8, 2001. Reference to "psychic underground" * [https://www.theglobeandmail.com/servlet/story/RTGAM.20050616.wxfraud16/BNStory/National/ 'Psychic surgeon' a heel, not a healer, police say] Globe and Mail story on Orbito's 2005 arrest in Toronto * [http://www.filipinoreporter.com/archive/3327/headline03.htm Psychic surgeon charged] Filipino Reporter story on Orbito's 2005 arrest in Toronto {{Parapsychology}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Psychic Surgery}} [[Category:Alternative medical treatments]] [[Category:Parapsychology]] [[Category:Pseudoscience]] [[Category:New Age]] [[Category:Sleight of hand]] [[Category:Supernatural healing]]

revision.comment: Removing [[:c:File:Indian_dance.jpg|Indian_dance.jpg]], it has been deleted from Commons by [[:c:User:Túrelio|Túrelio]] because: [[:c:COM:L|Copyright violation]]: copied from https://www.flickr.com/photos/29449221@N05/3213410752/.
revision.text:
The '''psychology of dance''' is the set of mental states associated with dancing and watching others dance. The term names the interdisciplinary academic field that studies those who do. Areas of research include interventions to increase health for older adults, programs for stimulating children’s creativity, [[dance movement therapy]], mate selection and emotional responses.
== Audience perception ==
Continuous response data provide [[choreographers]] information about audiences' perception of their dance material. Matches and mismatches between the choreographer's intention and the audience's response were found by continuously judging the emotions expressed when audience members watched Sue Haeley's ''Fine Line Terrain''. Key moments and intended structural changes described by the choreographer were mapped onto the continuous response data to compare the choreographer's intent and the audience's perception.<ref name=Stevens2>{{cite journal|last=Stevens|first=Catherine J.|author2=Schubert, Emery |author3=Morris, Rua Haszard |author4=Frear, Matt |author5=Chen, Johnson |author6=Healey, Sue |author7=Schoknecht, Colin |author8= Hansen, Stephen |title=Cognition and the temporal arts: Investigating audience response to dance using PDAs that record continuous data during live performance|journal=International Journal of Human-Computer Studies|year=2009|volume=67|issue=9|pages=800–813|doi=10.1016/j.ijhcs.2009.06.001}}</ref>
Surface features of dance contribute to audience [[arousal]]. Audience members continuously indicated their arousal and [[valence (psychology)|valence]] while viewing the Quantum Leap Youth Choreographic Ensemble's ''Landscape: time, place, and identity'' by continuously judging [[valence (psychology)|valence]] and emotion portrayed by the dance. Researchers compared this to choreographic notes about emotions expressed during the piece and found that arousal was related to changes in music and dancer activity.<ref name=Stevens2 />
== Recognizing emotion ==
=== Adults ===
[[Laban Movement Analysis]] categorizes human movement based on the duration of time and [[tempo]] changes, the contraction and expansion of limbs and the tension and dynamics of movement. In an experiment, subjects viewed 20 videos of dancers performing the same dance attempting to convey anger, fear, grief or joy. Viewers performed at an above-chance level for all but one performance of grief. The highest recognition rate was for grief, followed by anger, then joy. An automated recognition system attempted to find movement cues for different emotions. Fear was expressed with low fluency and many contractions in toward the body, joy with very fluent motion, and grief with frequent transitions between motion and pauses, reducing fluency. The extracted cues were validated by the spectators' recognition of the different emotions in movement and the dancers' performing the emotions similarly.<ref name=Camurri>{{cite journal|last=Camurri|first=Antonio|author2=Lagerlöf, Ingrid |author3=Volpe, Gualtiero |title=Recognizing emotion from dance movement: Comparison of spectator recognition and automated techniques|journal=International Journal of Human-Computer Studies|year=2003|volume=59|pages=213–225|doi=10.1016/S1071-5819(03)00050-8}}</ref>
Observers picked up emotion even without facial expressions. Raters with no dance experience watched videos of a dancer performing movement with seven different motives and six [[emotions]], but with a neutral face. Raters employed a list of motive terms including happy, lonely, sharp, natural, solemn, dynamic and flowing. They assessed emotional intensity on a scale of one to four concerning happiness, surprise, loneliness, fear, anger and disgust. All the intended emotions and motives were perceived, showing that attempts to communicate emotion and motivation via movement can succeed.<ref name=Sakata>{{cite journal|last=Sakata|first=Mamiko|author2=Mariko Shiba |author3=Kiyoshi Maiya |author4=Makoto Tadenuma |title=Human body as the medium in dance movement|journal=International Journal of Human-Computer Interaction|year=2004|volume=17|issue=3|pages=427–444|doi=10.1207/s15327590ijhc1703_7}}</ref>
Individuals participating in dance therapy identify feelings similar to those observing the activity. Participants attempted each posture after viewing a photograph or a model in the posture. Participants noted the emotion they associated with each posture. Responses were the same whether the subject was observing or embodying the posture, except for anger. Movers noted an anger response more often than observers.<ref name=Winters>{{cite journal|last=Winters|first=Allison F.|title=Emotion, embodiment, and mirror neurons in dance/movement therapy: A connection across disciplines|journal=American Journal of Dance Therapy|year=2008|volume=30|issue=2|pages=84–105|doi=10.1007/s10465-008-9054-y}}</ref>
=== Children ===
Four-, five-, and eight-year-old children and adults watched videos of movement expressing joy, anger, fear and sadness and indicated which emotions they perceived in each video. All age groups achieved recognition scores above chance level. The four-year-olds had the lowest scores, while the five-year-olds achieved levels close to the eight-year-olds' and the adults' scores.<ref name=Lagerlof>{{cite journal|last=Lagerlöf|first=Ingrid|author2=Djerf, Marie |title=Children's understanding of emotion in dance|journal=European Journal of Developmental Psychology|year=2009|volume=6|issue=4|pages=409–431|doi=10.1080/17405620701438475}}</ref>
== Expertise ==
=== Ballet and Indian dance ===
Untrained, frequent spectators and novices of ballet or Indian dance watched videos of ballet, Indian dance, and non-dance soloists. Motor-[[potential]]s (MEPs) in their hands and arms were used to measure [[corticospinal]] excitability. In ballet, the arms are used frequently, while the hands are used in Indian dance. Participants had higher MEPs in their arms when watching ballet compared to Indian dance. Ballet spectators' visual experience, not motor experience, drove motor resonance.<ref name=Jola>{{cite journal|last=Jola|first=Corinne|author2=Abedian-Amiri, Ali |author3=Kuppuswamy, Annapoorna |author4=Pollick, Frank E. |author5=Grosbras, Marie-Hélène |author6= Holmes, Nicholas P. |title=Motor simulation without motor expertise: Enhanced corticospinal excitability in visually experienced dance spectators|journal=PLoS ONE|year=2012|volume=7|issue=3|pages=e33343|doi=10.1371/journal.pone.0033343 |pmid=22457754 |pmc=3310063}}</ref>
=== Position sense ===
Dancers have more accurate [[Proprioception|position sense]] than non-dancers allowing them to rely more on position sense than vision.<ref name=Blasing1>{{cite journal|last=Bläsing|first=Bettina|author2=Calvo-Merino, Beatriz |author3=Cross, Emily S. |author4=Jola, Corinne |author5=Honisch, Juliane |author6= Stevens, Catherine J. |title=Neurocognitive control in dance perception and performance|journal=Acta Psychologica|year=2011|volume=139|issue=2|pages=300–308|doi=10.1016/j.actpsy.2011.12.005}}</ref> Experts, amateurs and novices differ in their mental representations based on spatial parameters. Subjects in each group viewed clips of basic [[classical ballet]] steps and noted the spatial parameters of basic action concepts (BACs), which are mental representations of each part of a movement. For the [[pas assemblé]], amateurs and experts clustered the movement into functional phases, but for the [[pirouette]], only experts had adequate spatial parameters. This suggests that experts retain spatial parameters in their long-term memory and that dancers use mental imagery to memorize long complex phrases.<ref name=Blasing2>{{cite journal|last=Bläsing|first=Bettina|author2=Schack, Thomas |title=Mental representation of spatial movement parameters in dance|journal=Spatial Cognition & Computation|year=2012|volume=12|pages=111–132|doi=10.1080/13875868.2011.626095}}</ref>
== Participating in dance ==
Dancers think in different modes, remember complex movement and respond to the other dancers. Communication between dancers occurs through direct perception of motion, recognition of structure and neural mirroring. Dancers' memory includes [[procedural knowledge]] of how to move their bodies and [[declarative knowledge]] of specific combinations. Thus, dance is similar to language, where grammar depends on procedural memory and memory of words depends on declarative memory. Dance also involves feelings and personal experience.<ref name=Stevens>{{cite journal|last=Stevens|first=Catherine|author2=McKechnie, Shirley |title=Thinking in action: Thought made visible in contemporary dance|journal=Cognitive Processing|year=2005|volume=6|issue=4|pages=243–252|doi=10.1007/s10339-005-0014-x}}</ref>
Each contemporary dancer has a moving identity as a result of a collection of choreographic and training influences that reveals a personal narrative.<ref name=Roche>{{cite journal|last=Roche|first=Jenny|title=Embodying multiplicity: The independent contemporary dancer’s moving identity|journal=Research in Dance Education|year=2011|volume=12|issue=2|pages=105–118|doi=10.1080/14647893.2011.575222}}</ref>
One [[Duke University]] study found that dancers learn routines in different ways, whether by dancing at half speed or in their minds.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://blog.dancehub.com/psychological-studies-dancing/ | title=5 Interesting Psychological Studies That Involve Dancing | publisher=DanceHub | date=27 October 2014 | accessdate=9 November 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dukechronicle.com/articles/2013/10/31/research-investigates-science-behind-dance | title=Research investigates the science behind dance | publisher=The Chronicle | date=31 October 2013 | accessdate=9 November 2014 | author=Shulklapper, Kali}}</ref>
A study has found that participating in synchronised dancing facilitates group bonding and higher pain thresholds more so than participating in unsynchronised dancing together.<ref>https://theconversation.com/lets-dance-synchronised-movement-helps-us-tolerate-pain-and-foster-friendship-49835</ref>
== Emotion ==
[[File:CIJam.jpg|thumb|Dance Improvisation]]
=== Empathy ===
[[Empathy]] mediates cognition in [[dance improvisation]]. Through understanding others' emotions and intentions, dancers make affective motor decisions. Improvised movement is based on [[embodied cognition]], the theory that the body reveals the nature of the mind, [[motor cognition]], that cognition is embodied in action, [[social cognition]], dancers' understanding of others' actions and emotions, and [[situated cognition]], that knowing is inseparable from action. [[Mirror neurons]] underlie many movements, allowing dancers to subconsciously respond to stimuli from the other dancers. Empathy provides temporary structuring of movements, which allows contact improvisation to be a kind of choreography.<ref name=Ribeiro>{{cite journal|last=Ribeiro|first=Mônica M.|author2=Fonseca, Agar |title=The empathy and the structuring sharing modes of movement sequences in the improvisation of contemporary dance|journal=Research in Dance Education|year=2011|volume=12|issue=2|pages=71–85|doi=10.1080/14647893.2011.575220}}</ref>
=== Creativity ===
Emotions were shown to affect creativity through arousal and valence interactions for subjects playing the [[video game]] ''[[Dance Dance Revolution]]''. Participants were randomly assigned to three different levels of exertion, representing levels of arousal. While the participants danced, an experimenter randomly gave them either a very bad grade or a very good grade, attempting to affect the subject's mood. After dancing, the participants were tested on valence, mood, arousal, creativity and level of physical and mental energy. Lower arousal levels resulted in higher creativity scores when a negative mood was induced. With higher arousal levels, a positive mood resulted in greater creativity than a negative mood.<ref name=Hutton>{{cite journal|last=Hutton|first=Elizabeth|author2=Sundar, S. Shyam |title=Can video games enhance creativity? Effects of emotion generated by Dance Dance Revolution|journal=Creativity Research Journal|year=2010|volume=22|issue=3|pages=294–303|doi=10.1080/10400419.2010.503540}}</ref>
==Schools== Dance employs emotion, creativity, cultural influence and symbolism to convey meaning. Dance resembles verbal language because it has a [[vocabulary]] (dance movements) and [[grammar]] (system for combining movements).<ref name=Hanna /> Dance increases connectedness among students and between students and teachers in the classroom.<ref name=Melchior>{{cite journal|last=Melchior|first=Elizabeth|title=Culturally responsive dance pedagogy in the primary classroom|journal=Research in Dance Education|year=2011|volume=12|issue=2|pages=119–135|doi=10.1080/14647893.2011.575223}}</ref> In schools students can enhance [[theory of multiple intelligences|bodily-kinesthetic intelligence]], reorganize neural pathways to improve learning, and express knowledge through dance.<ref name=Hanna>{{cite journal|last=Hanna|first=J. L.|title=A nonverbal language for imagining and learning: Dance education in K-12 curriculum|journal=Educational Researcher|year=2008|volume=37|issue=8|pages=491–506|doi=10.3102/0013189X08326032}}</ref>
Dance helps students to develop a sense of self as an emotional and social being. In [[preschool]], children developed language, movement and collaborative skills to express their ideas. They created and named poses, learned ways of breathing to apply in different emotional situations, mirrored others' movements, incorporated emotions into their movement and participated in free movement. Children enhanced their social cognition and raised their awareness of their bodies.<ref name=Thom>{{cite journal|last=Thom|first=Lily|title=From simple line to expressive movement: The use of creative movement to enhance socio-emotional development in the preschool curriculum|journal=American Journal of Dance Therapy|year=2010|volume=32|issue=2|pages=100–112|doi=10.1007/s10465-010-9090-2}}</ref>
== Therapy ==
=== Dance movement therapy ===
[[Dementia]] patients who participated in a [[dance therapy|dance movement therapy]] (DMT) intervention showed improved cognition compared to a control group. The intervention group participated in nine thirty- to forty-minute sessions of dance movement therapy. The control and intervention groups completed the [[Mini–mental state examination|Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE)]], the Word List savings score, the [[Activities of daily living#Instrumental ADLs|instrumental activities of daily living (IADLs)]] and the [[Executive dysfunction#Clock drawing test|Clock Drawing Test]] a week before, immediately before, at week five, at week nine and four weeks after the intervention. MMSE scores improved in the DMT group at follow-up and IADL scores improved in the DMT group at week 9. The changes were small, but intervention-related improvements in visuospatial ability were found.<ref name=Hokkanen>{{cite journal|last=Hokkanen|first=Laura |author2=Rantala, Leena |author3=Remes, Anne |author4=Harkonen, Birgitta |author5=Viramo, Petteri |author6=Winblad, Ilkka|title=Dance and movement therapeutic methods in management of dementia: A randomized, controlled study|journal=Journal of the American Geriatrics Society|year=2008|volume=56|issue=4|pages=771–772|doi=10.1111/j.1532-5415.2008.01611.x}}</ref>
=== Aerobic dance === An aerobic dance program improved older adults' [[Executive functions|executive function]]. Participants were assigned to a freestyle workout, which involved patterns of movement, or a combination style workout, in which they learned a long choreographic routine. Their cognitive function was tested immediately before and after the forty-minute dance class with a [[Task switching (psychology)|task-switching reaction time test]]. Performance improved in the combination group after the program, while there was no change in the freestyle group.<ref name=Kimura>{{cite journal|last=Kimura|first=Ken|author2=Hozumi, Noriko |title=Investigating the acute effect of an aerobic dance exercise program on neuro-cognitive function in the elderly|journal=Psychology of Sport and Exercise|year=2012|volume=13|issue=5|pages=623–629|doi=10.1016/j.psychsport.2012.04.001}}</ref>
=== Jazz dance ===
A [[jazz dance]] class study was conducted to improve older adults' balance, cognition and mood. These were measured with the MMSE, [[Geriatric Depression Scale]] (GDS), and Sensory Organization Test (SOT), respectively before (time 1), at the midpoint (time 2), and after (time 3) the class. Differences in MMSE and GDS scores were not significant, but SOT scores increased from time 1 to time 2 and from time 2 to time 3.<ref name=Alpert>{{cite journal|last=Alpert|first=Patricia T|author2=Miller, Sally K |author3=Wallmann, Harvey |author4=Havey, Richard |author5=Cross, Chad |author6=Chevalia, Theresa |author7=Gillis, Carrie B |author8= Kodandapari, Keshavan |title=The effect of modified jazz dance on balance, cognition, and mood in older adults|journal=Journal of the American Academy of Nurse Practitioners|year=2009|volume=21|issue=2|pages=108–115|doi=10.1111/j.1745-7599.2008.00392.x}}</ref>
== Implications about mate selection ==
=== Symmetry ===
[[Charles Darwin]] suggested that dance is a signal for [[natural selection]] in courtship. [[Fluctuating asymmetry]] (FA) measures quality of dancing, where higher scores indicate lower quality. Higher FA individuals are less attractive. They are more likely to engage with other FA individuals. A [[motion capture]] study of videos of Jamaican dancers, altered to make the dancers unrecognizable used FA ratings to categorize the dancers. Male and female subjects assessed dancing ability and identified the dancer's sex. Symmetrical dancers were rated as significantly better than others, but female symmetry accounted for less than it did in males. Female evaluators more strongly preferred symmetrical male dancers than male evaluators, while there was no gender difference in ratings of female dancers. Lower FA male evaluators were less likely to prefer dances performed by symmetrical females.<ref name=Brown>{{cite journal|last=Brown|first=William M.|author2=Cronk, Lee |author3=Grochow, Keith |author4=Jacobson, Amy |author5=Liu, C. Karen |author6=Popović, Zoran |author7= Trivers, Robert |title=Dance reveals symmetry especially in young men|journal=Nature|year=2005|volume=438|issue=7071|pages=1148–1150|doi=10.1038/nature04344}}</ref>
=== Risk-taking ===
[[Sexual selection|Mate preference]] occurs when women perceive risk-taking in men from motion cues in dance. Non-professional heterosexual male dancers completed the [[Sensation seeking|Sensation Seeking]] Scale (SSS-V) assessing their attitudes towards risky activities, thrill-seeking, partying and sexual activities. Women viewed videos of them dancing alone in a room and rated them on perceived risk-taking and perceived attractiveness. Mean attractiveness ratings of the dancers correlated positively with their mean risk-taking and sensation seeking ratings.{{clarify|date=January 2013|reason=Did they correlate with the women's ratings of perceived risk-taking or the men's self-ratings?}}<ref name=Hugill>{{cite journal|last=Hugill|first=Nadine|author2=Fink, Bernhard |author3=Neave, Nick |author4=Besson, Anna |author5= Bunse, Laurel |title=Women’s perception of men’s sensation seeking propensity from their dance movements|journal=Personality and Individual Differences|year=2011|volume=51|issue=4|pages=483–487|doi=10.1016/j.paid.2011.05.002}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Dance research]] [[Category:Psychology]] [[Category:Dance and health]] [[Category:Dance science]]

{{distinguish|Runabout (series)}} {{Infobox video game | title = Roundabout | image = Roundabout - Title.jpg | developer = No Goblin LLC | publisher = No Goblin LLC | engine = [[Unity (game engine)|Unity]] | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]], [[OS X]], [[Linux]], [[Xbox One]], [[PlayStation 4]], [[PlayStation Vita]] | released = '''Windows, OS X, Linux'''
September 18, 2014{{cite web|title=Roundabout official press kit|url=http://www.nogoblin.com/presskit/roundabout/|accessdate=29 October 2018}}
'''Xbox One'''
February 20, 2015
'''PlayStation 4'''
May 26, 2015{{cite web|title=Roundabout on PS4|url=http://ca.ign.com/games/roundabout/ps4-20021445|website=[[IGN]]|accessdate=25 July 2015}}
'''PlayStation Vita'''
June 26, 2018 | genre = [[Open-world]] [[Racing video game|driving game]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''''Roundabout''''' is an [[open-world]] [[indie video game|indie]] [[Racing video game|driving]] video game developed and published by American indie studio No Goblin LLC. It was released for [[Windows]], [[Mac OS|Mac]] and [[Linux]] on September 18, 2014, for [[Xbox One]] on February 20, 2015, and for [[PlayStation 4]] on May 26, 2015. A [[PlayStation Vita]] port was released on June 26, 2018, as a cross-buy title with the PlayStation 4 version. The game involves a constantly-rotating [[limousine]] which the player has to drive around an open world while completing miscellaneous objectives such as pick up and dropping people off or finding collectible items. The gameplay has been described as inspired by ''[[Kuru Kuru Kururin]]'' (where you also control a constantly-rotating vehicle), and ''[[Crazy Taxi (video game)|Crazy Taxi]]'' (where the goal of the game is to drive [[Non-player character|NPCs]] from one location to another). ==Gameplay== {{multiple image|align=left|footer=Players drive a constantly revolving limousine, and must deliver passengers (introduced through [[full motion video]] cutscenes, left) to their intended destinations while avoiding obstacles.| footer_align=center| width=215| direction=horizontal| image1=Roundabout - FMV Screenshot 02.png| image2=Roundabout - Screenshot 02.png| image3=Roundabout - Screenshot 04.png}} {{clear}} ==Plot== Roundabout is set in 1977 and follows the adventures of Georgio Manos; the world's first revolving limousine driver who drives around the citizens of the city of Roundabout on their daily needs. Though most of the jobs are unrelated and commuters are only seen once or twice, frequent passenger Elizabeth earns Georgio's deep admiration, and a romance begins to develop between the two. Eventually Georgio develops a rivalry with another revolving limousine driver, Ronaldo, whom Georgio unknowingly taught everything they knew and allowed Ronaldo to overtake Georgio as the #1 revolving limousine driver in the city. Desperate to defeat Ronaldo, Georgio acquires some candy dots with the help of Mickey the mechanic, which allows Georgio to see Jeffrey the Skeleton. Guided by Jeffrey in a candy-dot fuelled frenzy, Georgio goes on a murderous rampage through the city. Georgio then challenges Ronaldo again, spurred on by Elizabeth, and as they race through the city streets Georgio runs Ronaldo off the road, destroying his car and killing him. Six months later, Georgio has retreated to the mountains in the north out of shame, as destroying someone else's car is akin to treason in Roundabout. Having lost Elizabeth and running low on candy dots, Jeffrey urges Georgio to get their act back together and win back Elizabeth's heart. At the same time, Georgio is hounded by Ge-op (Georgio Operations), a police squad tasked with hunting down Georgio after they killed Ronaldo. In the end, Georgio and Elizabeth are reunited, and Elizabeth explains that she is tired of Georgio's constant spinning, pleading Georgio to drive straight for even a little while. After Georgio awkwardly attempts to drive straight, Elizabeth decides that she shouldn't force Georgio to be someone they're not, and the two drive off into the sunset together. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | title = Roundabout | subtitle = | state = plain | align = right | MC = XONE: 74/100{{cite web|title=Roundabout Xbox One|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-one/roundabout|website=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=25 July 2015}}
PC:75/100{{cite web|title=Roundabout PC|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/roundabout|website=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=25 July 2015}} | IGN = | PCGUK = | VG = | rev1 = ''Push Square'' | rev1Score = PS4: 6/10{{cite web|last1=Kennedy|first1=Phil|title=I'm spinning around|url=http://www.pushsquare.com/reviews/ps4/roundabout|website=PushSquare|publisher=Gamer Network Ltd.|accessdate=25 July 2015|date=10 June 2015}} | rev2 = [[IGN|IGN Spain]] | rev2Score = XONE: 5.5/10{{cite web|last1=Artero|first1=Javier|title=El juego de conducción más raro jamás jugado|trans-title=The rarest driving game ever played|url=http://es.ign.com/roundabout-xbox-one/91328/review/roundabout-analisis-para-xbox-one-y-pc|website=[[IGN|IGN Spain]]|accessdate=25 July 2015|language=SPanish|date=February 26, 2015}} | Poly = PC: 7.5/10{{cite web|url=http://www.polygon.com/2014/9/25/6840747/roundabout-review-pc-ps4-xbox-one|title=Roundabout Review: Taxi Driver|last=Tach|first=Dave|work=[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]]|publisher=[[Vox Media]]|date=September 25, 2014|accessdate=July 25, 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150515093314/http://www.polygon.com/2014/9/25/6840747/roundabout-review-pc-ps4-xbox-one|archivedate=May 15, 2015|dead-url=no}} | rev3 = | rev3Score = | award1Pub = | award1 = }} {{expand section|date=July 2015}} The game received positive reviews upon release. The versions for each console received different scores despite being identical to each other. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Roundabout}} *{{official website|http://roundaboutgame.com}} [[Category:2014 video games]] [[Category:Indie video games]] [[Category:Full motion video based games]] [[Category:Linux games]] [[Category:Open world video games]] [[Category:MacOS games]] [[Category:PlayStation 4 games]] [[Category:PlayStation Vita games]] [[Category:Racing video games]] [[Category:Single-player video games]] [[Category:Steam Greenlight games]] [[Category:Unity (game engine) games]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United States]] [[Category:Video games set in 1977]] [[Category:Xbox One games]] [[Category:Video games featuring female protagonists]] [[Category:LGBT-related video games]]

{{about|the singer with the Haydn Quartet|the vaudeville entertainer and theater entrepreneur|Sherman H. Dudley}} [[File:S.H. Dudley.jpg|thumb|Portrait of recording pioneer Samuel H. Rous, who performed as S.H. Dudley.]]
'''Samuel Holland Rous''' (15 January 1864 – 6 June 1947), who recorded using the name '''S. H. Dudley''', and less frequently as '''Frank Kernell''', was an [[United States|American]] singer, pioneer recording artist, and music business executive. He was unrelated to the black [[vaudeville]] performer and impresario [[Sherman Houston Dudley]].
==Biography== He was born in [[Greencastle, Indiana]], the son of a music teacher.<ref name=fma>[http://freemusicarchive.org/member/JoeMc/blog/Couldnt_Hardly_Notice_It Free Music Archive, ''Moonlighter's Serenade'', 25 March 2010]. Retrieved 23 May 2013</ref><ref>[http://search.ancestry.co.uk/cgi-bin/sse.dll?rank=1&new=1&MSAV=1&msT=1&gss=angs-g&gsfn=Samuel+Holland&gsln=Rous&cpxt=1&catBucket=rstp&uidh=jq5&cp=12&pcat=ROOT_CATEGORY&h=760455&recoff=5+6+7+32&db=USpassports&indiv=1 US Passport Application, 1920]. Retrieved 23 May 2013</ref> After leaving school he found work as a [[baritone]] in touring [[light opera]] companies,<ref name=brooks>[https://books.google.com/books?id=r-k9ysIaaEUC&pg=PA520&lpg=PA520&dq=%22S.+H.+Dudley%22+rous&source=bl&ots=T55nxQ6aeP&sig=UMP1sNy0oYsC31uzM4IsTjQYHvQ&hl=en&sa=X&ei=vCOeUdK4CM-EhQfTmYCIAw&ved=0CE0Q6AEwBA#v=onepage&q=%22S.%20H.%20Dudley%22%20rous&f=false Tim Brooks, ''Lost Sounds: Blacks and the Birth of the Recording Industry, 1890-1919'', University of Illinois Press, 2004, p.520]</ref> and from the mid 1880s — with his wife, Sofia Romani, a [[soprano]] — toured the US, [[Mexico]] and [[South America]] as a member of the [[Emma Juch]] and Marie Tavary operatic ensembles.<ref name=billboard>[https://books.google.com/books?id=WQwEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA49&lpg=PA49&dq=%22S.+H.+Dudley%22+rous&source=bl&ots=8qeKoJKSZW&sig=VhrWa115i7bS-GaqIEOa3DmgLEo&hl=en&sa=X&ei=fiSeUa6WAcWJhQeWyYDQAQ&ved=0CGgQ6AEwCTgK#v=onepage&q=%22S.%20H.%20Dudley%22%20rous&f=false ''Billboard'' obituary, Sam H. Rous, 5 July 1947]. Retrieved 23 May 2013</ref><ref name="whitburn memories">{{cite book| last1 = Whitburn | first1 = Joel| title = Pop Memories 1890-1954: The History of American Popular Music| location = Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin| publisher = Record Research, Inc. | year= 1986| pages = 142| isbn = 0-89820-083-0}}</ref>
He continued to perform opera until 1896, when he began recording for the [[Berliner Records|Berliner]] and [[Edison Records|Edison]] companies, both as a solo performer and as a member of [[vocal group]]s. On recordings he used the pseudonym S. H. Dudley, perhaps deliberately using the name of the black vaudeville performer [[Sherman H. Dudley]] who was becoming popular at that time. Rous later claimed he was ignorant of the "real" S. H. Dudley's existence.<ref name=sutton>[http://www.mainspringpress.com/macdonough.html Allan Sutton, ''Harry Macdonough - Victor's Singing Executive'', Mainspring Press]. Retrieved 23 May 2013</ref>
He principally recorded for [[Victor Records]]. As a solo singer, using the name Dudley, he often recorded "[[coon songs]]" and other stereotypical [[minstrel show]] material.<ref name=brooks/><ref name=sutton/> One of his biggest commercial successes was his recording of "When Reuben Comes To Town" in 1901.<ref name="whitburn memories"/> He recorded the song "Whistling", [[whistling|a skill]] for which he was noted, and comic songs such as "Miss Helen Hunt", with the mildly risqué line "Go to Helen Hunt for it".<ref name=fma/> He also recorded as a duo with [[Harry Macdonough]].<ref name="whitburn memories"/>
He was an integral member of the Edison Male Quartet, which became [[The Haydn Quartet]], along with Harry Macdonough, [[John Bieling]], and [[William F. Hooley]].<ref name=billboard/><ref name=loc>[https://www.loc.gov/jukebox/artists/detail/id/5042/ Library of Congress: S. H. Dudley]. Retrieved 23 May 2013</ref> The group was one of the most popular of the period, and had a number of successes including "[[In the Good Old Summer Time]]" (1903), "Bedelia" (1904), "[[Sweet Adeline (song)|Sweet Adeline (You're the Flower of My Heart)]]" (1904), "How'd You Like To Spoon With Me" (with [[Corinne Morgan]], 1906), "[[Take Me Out to the Ball Game]]" (with [[Billy Murray (singer)|Billy Murray]], 1908), "Sunbonnet Sue" (1908), "Put On Your Old Gray Bonnet" (1909), and "[[By the Light of the Silvery Moon (song)|By the Light of the Silv'ry Moon]]" (with Murray, 1910). On some of the group's later recordings, he was replaced by [[Reinald Werrenrath]].<ref name="whitburn 2">Whitburn, ''Pop Memories 1890-1954: The History of American Popular Music'' pp. 201-203</ref>
In 1902, Sam Rous, using his real name, was appointed as assistant manager of Victor Records' [[artists and repertoire]] division. He gave the company's star singer Billy Murray the [[sobriquet]] "The Denver Nightingale".<ref>[http://www.denvernightingale.com/ "The Denver Nightingale", Billy Murray fan site]. Retrieved 23 May 2013</ref> Rous continued to record for several years, both as Dudley and using the pseudonym Frank Kernell, but at a much reduced level.<ref name=brooks/> He was also the first editor of Victor's record catalog, the ''Victor Book of the Opera'' (or ''Victrola Book of the Opera''), first published in 1912.<ref name=billboard/><ref name=loc/> This contained illustrated details of the plots and production histories of [[opera]]s, and cataloged available Victor recordings of them. The book went through many editions, and remained in print until 1976.<ref>[https://www.loc.gov/jukebox/victor-book-of-the-opera Library of Congress National Jukebox: Victrola Book of the Opera]. Retrieved 23 May 2013</ref>
He retired in 1919, and with his wife went to live in [[France]]. They returned to the US shortly before [[World War Two]], and lived in [[California]]. Rous died in [[Los Angeles]] in 1947, at the age of 83; his wife, who had been paralysed for several years, died the next day.<ref name=billboard/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://victor.library.ucsb.edu/index.php/talent/detail/5880/Dudley_S._H._vocalist_baritone_vocal Victor Records discography]
{{authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Dudley (singer), S. H.}} [[Category:1864 births]] [[Category:1947 deaths]] [[Category:Pioneer recording artists]] [[Category:American operatic baritones]] [[Category:Victor Records artists]] [[Category:Columbia Records artists]] [[Category:Edison Records artists]] [[Category:Musicians from Indiana]] [[Category:People from Greencastle, Indiana]]

{{Infobox television |show_name = Scarlet Heart 2 |image = Scarlet Heart 2.jpg |image_size = 270px |caption = Official poster |genre = [[Romance film|Romance]]
[[Drama]] |creator = |developer = |writer = |director = Lee Kwok-lap |creative_director = |presenter = |starring = [[Cecilia Liu]]
[[Nicky Wu]]
[[Sun Yizhou]]
[[Jiang Jinfu]] |judges = |voices = |narrated = |theme_music_composer = |opentheme = ''Step by Step'' by [[Mayday (Taiwanese band)|Mayday]] |endtheme = ''Dust'' by [[Jia Jia (singer)|Jia Jia]] |composer = |country = Mainland China |language = Mandarin |num_seasons = |num_episodes = 39 (original), 35 (DVD) |list_episodes = |executive_producer = |producer = Karen Tsoi |editor = |location = China ([[Tianjin]], [[Beijing]], [[Ningxia]], [[Hong Kong]]) |cinematography = |camera = |runtime = 45 minutes per episode |company = [[Chinese Entertainment Shanghai]] |distributor = |channel = [[Zhejiang TV|Zhejiang STV]] |picture_format = |audio_format = |first_run = |first_aired = {{Start date|2014|4|22|df=y}} |last_aired = {{Start date|2014|5|7|df=y}} |status = |preceded_by = [[Scarlet Heart]] |followed_by = |related = |website = |production_website = }} {{Chinese|t=步步驚情|s=步步惊情|p=Bùbù Jīngqíng|pic=Scarlet Heart 2 (Main title card).jpg|piccap=Main title card}} '''''Scarlet Heart 2''''' ([[Chinese language|Chinese]]: 步步惊情) is a 2014 Chinese television series. It is the sequel to ''[[Scarlet Heart]]'' (2011), and continues the story after the [[time travel]]ing protagonist, Zhang Xiao ([[Cecilia Liu]]), returns to her own time following the death of Ma'ertai Ruoxi. The story is not considered to be canon to [[Tong Hua (writer)|Tong Hua]]'s novel ''[[Bu Bu Jing Xin]]'' because the author never wrote a sequel, although some of the cast members from the first series have returned. Unlike its predecessor, the series does not involve time traveling and will be set in the present, resolving the loose ends left by the [[cliffhanger]]. It began filming in [[Tianjin]], China on March 2013 and ended in [[Hong Kong]] on June 2013.{{cite web|url=http://sg.entertainment.yahoo.com/news/bu-bu-jing-qing-begins-filming-090400840.html|work=Yahoo! News|title="Bu Bu Jing Qing" begins filming}}{{cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/v/m/2013-06-07/18003938858.shtml|work=Sina|title=《步步惊情》香港杀青添浪漫 模仿大黄鸭|language=zh}} The series aired on [[Zhejiang TV]] from 22 April to 7 May 2014.{{cite web |url= http://www.jaynestars.com/news/bu-bu-jing-qing-set-to-premiere-on-april-22 |title= "Bu Bu Jing Qing" Set to Premiere on April 22 |accessdate= 2014-03-19|work= jaynestars.com}} Due to the restrictions on time-traveling dramas in Mainland China, the 39 original episodes were cut down to 35 and re-assembled to 41. ==Synopsis== It has been three months since Zhang Xiao woke up from a coma and she can't forget about the Fourth Prince. One day, at the museum, she meets a man identical to him; He is Yin Zheng, the stepson of Zhentian Corporation's chairman. To find out his connection with the Fourth Prince, Zhang Xiao becomes a designer at Zhentian. Shortly after, however, an accident occurs and she loses her memories as Ruoxi. She starts to date a kind man named Kang Sihan, Yin Zheng's stepbrother; meanwhile, the latter dates Lan Lan, a model identical to Zhang Xiao who hides a mysterious past. Helped by his uncle, Yin Zheng wants to revenge the death of his biological father by ruining Kang Zhentian. Due to her connection with Sihan, Zhang Xiao finds herself unwittingly caught in the center of a power struggle. ==Cast== * [[Cecilia Liu]] as Zhang Xiao / Lan Lan ** Chai Wei as Zhang Xiao / Lan Lan (child) * [[Nicky Wu]] as Yin Zheng ** Zheng Wei as Yin Zheng (child) * [[Sun Yizhou]] as Kang Sihan ** Bian Chen as Kang Sihan (child) * [[Jiang Jinfu]] as Kang Siyu * [[Damian Lau]] as Kang Zhentian ** Huang You Ming as Kang Zhentian (young) * [[Chen Xiang]] as Huang Di, Zhang Xiao's ex-boyfriend * Ye Zuxin as Jack * [[Yico Zeng]] as Ling Dang, Siyu's best friend * Cai Yatong as Mo Xiaohe, Zhang Xiao's colleague * Gan Yu as Zhang Zejiang, Zhang Xiao's father * Ye Qing as Meng Xinyi, Zhang Xiao's best friend and Sihan's girlfriend * Zhang Jiang as Zhou Yue, Sihan's best friend * [[Annie Liu]] as Ma Yinuo * Yin Zhuzheng as Yin Chenggui, Yin Zheng's uncle * Zhao Chulun as Han Qing, Yin Chenggui's right hand * He Yin as Zhao Lan, Yin Zheng's mother * Wu Li as Qiao Qi, Yin Zheng's secretary * Wang Zhifei as Yin Chengyi, Yin Zheng's father * Deng Limin as Liu Donghai, director at Zhentian group * Da Li as Wang Tiecheng, director at Zhentian group * – as Xiao Hua, Zhang Xiao's biological father * [[Cecilia Liu]] as Qin Yuzhen, Zhang Xiao's mother * Gu Yan as Meng Yinan, Xinyi's mother ==Soundtrack== {{Infobox album | name = ''Scarlet Heart 2'' Original Soundtrack
''步步驚情'' 電視原聲帶 | type = Soundtrack | artist = Various artists | cover = Scarlet Heart 2 Original TV Soundtrack.jpg | alt = | caption = Album cover for Taiwan market | released = April 25, 2014 | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Mandapop]] | length = | label = Produced by B'in Music
Distributed by [[Sony Music Entertainment|Sony Music Entertainment Taiwan]] | producer = | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }} {{Track listing | collapsed = no | headline = ''Scarlet Heart 2'': Original Soundtrack | title1 = ''Step by Step'' (步步) | length1 = 04:33 | music1 = [[Mayday (Taiwanese band)|Mayday]] | title2 = ''Dust'' (塵埃) | length2 = 05:27 | music2 = [[Jia Jia (singer)|Jia Jia]] | title3 = ''Lose Myself'' (不在乎) | length3 = 03:57 | music3 = [[Richie Jen]] | title4 = ''Stutter'' (結巴) | length4 = 03:38 | music4 = [[Yen-j]] and [[Puff Guo]] | title5 = ''Second Love'' (身不由己) | length5 = 04:16 | music5 = [[Ding Dang (singer)|Ding Dang]] | title6 = ''Not About Kindness'' (無關善良) | length6 = 04:40 | music6 = [[Victor Wong (singer)|Victor Wong]] | title7 = ''The Miracle of Meeting Again'' (再續前緣) | length7 = 03:34 | music7 =Ying-Hua Huang & [[Christof Unterberger]] | title8 = ''Which Chaotic Age Does Not Cause Goodbyes?'' (哪個亂世沒有離別) | length8 = 01:32 | music8 = | title9 = ''With Love As Passionate As the Skies'' (愛如穹蒼般壯烈) | length9 = 02:02 | music9 = | title10 = ''Do We Know Each Other?'' (我們認識嗎？) | length10 = 03:34 | music10 = | title11 = ''Go for You in Your World'' (去你的世界找你) | length11 = 02:43 | music11 =Ying-Hua Huang & [[Christof Unterberger]] | title12 = ''Love and Not Forgetting'' (相依相愛難相忘) | length12 = 04:10 | music12 Ying-Hua Huang & [[Christof Unterberger]] | title13 = ''This Life'' (今生今世) | length13 = 04:29 | music13 =Ying-Hua Huang & [[Christof Unterberger]] | title14 = ''Happiness of the Future'' (未來的幸福) | length14 = 03:02 | music14 =Ying-Hua Huang & [[Christof Unterberger]] | total_length = }} ==Awards and nominations== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! Award !! Category !! Nominated work !! Result |- |rowspan=3|2014 || rowspan=3| 6th [[China TV Drama Awards]] || Actor with the Most Media Influence ||[[Nicky Wu]]||{{won}} |- | Most Commercially Valuable Actress || [[Liu Shishi]]||{{won}} |- | Most Promising Actor || [[Sun Yizhou]] ||{{won}} |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.tangrenmedia.com/multi/tv/tv0028.shtml ''Scarlet Heart 2''] at [[Tangren Media]] {{zh icon}} *{{official website|http://www.bs-j.co.jp/jyakugi2/}} {{ja icon}} {{Tong Hua (writer)}} {{Zhejiang Television Dramas}} [[Category:Scarlet Heart]] [[Category:Chinese romance television series]] [[Category:Television series by Tangren Media]] [[Category:Sequel television series]] [[Category:Fashion-themed television series]] [[Category:2014 Chinese television series debuts]] [[Category:2014 Chinese television series endings]] [[Category:Zhejiang Television shows]]

revision.text:
''For the Australian television series of the same name see: [[Snake Tales (TV series)]]''
''For the missions mode of the same name see: [[Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance]]'' {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Use Australian English|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox Comic strip |title=Snake Tales |creator=[[Allan Salisbury]] |status= daily gag panel | first = 25 April 1974 | altnames = ''The Old Timer'' | genre = humor }} '''''Snake Tales''''' (also known as simply '''''Snake''''', after the main character) is a [[gag-a-day]] [[comic strip]] written by [[Australia]]n [[cartoonist]] [[Sols|Allan Salisbury (aka Sols)]]. == Publication history == ''Snake Tales'' was originally titled ''The Old Timer'' and was first published in ''[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]]'' on 25 April 1974. The initial group of characters featured: The Old Timer, an elderly bloke with a long thirst and a reluctance to [[Round of drinks|shout]] for [[beer]]s; The Con Man; The [[Kangaroo]], who constantly avoids being killed for food; the [[Royal Flying Doctor Service of Australia|Flyin' Doc]]; and The Last Lost Tribesman and his Wife, who are determined to stay lost. In July 1975 ''[[The Sun News-Pictorial]]'' published the strip as a replacement for [[Les Dixon]]'s ''[[Bluey and Curley]]''. Sols gradually added characters including Crazy [[Saltwater Crocodile|Croc]], Lillie (the Old Timer's distant admirer), a devious butcher, a group of duck hunters, the comic strip didn't make a great impression until the introduction of the character ''Snake''. Snake was first introduced in 1975http://www.snakecartoons.com/school.htmhttps://visualhumor.files.wordpress.com/2013/09/best-of-intro-cartoons-02.jpg and gradually gained greater prominence to the point where the name of the strip was changed to ''Snake Tales'' in 1978. The strip has now been internationally [[print syndication|syndicated]] and appears in over 450 [[newspaper]]s (both daily and Sunday editions) worldwide. When it was syndicated in the United States (through the [[Newspaper Enterprise Association]]),"Newswatch: Australian Strip From N.E.A.," ''The Comics Journal'' #73 (July 1982). Sols was asked to re-draw Lady Snake, as her "two lumps" were said to be offensive. He drew her with a bikini top instead.Bateman, Daniel. "Snake's still after his buxom lady", ''[[Townsville Bulletin]]'', 15 March 2008, p. 20. == Story and characters == The strip is set in an unspecified location in the Australian outback. Occasionally a shot of a traditional outback [[public house|pub]] by itself on a lone road is seen. The principal characters include: * '''Snake''': a not very smart poisonous snake. * '''Lady Snake''': the Snake's girlfriend. * '''The Flyin' Doc''': a pilot with the [[Royal Flying Doctors|Australian Royal Flying Doctors Service]] == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{official|http://www.snakecartoons.com}} [[Category:Australian comic strips]] [[Category:Australian comics titles]] [[Category:1974 comics debuts]] [[Category:Australian comics characters]] [[Category:Gag-a-day comics]] [[Category:Fictional snakes]] [[Category:2000 films]] [[Category:Comics spin-offs]] [[Category:Comics set in Australia]] [[Category:Fictional characters who became a protagonist in a spin-off]] {{comic-strip-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox film | name = Sunken Plum | image = File:Sunken Plum International Poster (Ciruela de agua dulce, Chen Li) Dir. Roberto F. Canuto & Xu Xiaoxi. Poster International.jpg | image_size = 215px | alt = | caption = Sunken Plum (Chen Li) international poster | director = [[Roberto F. Canuto]]
[[Xu Xiaoxi]] | producer = Leng Zhiwen | writer = [[Roberto F. Canuto]]
[[Xu Xiaoxi]] | starring = Gu Xiang
Yu Yinmeng
Tian Peng
Li Lierong
Chen Jiaqi
Yao Zhexing
Zhang Zhijiu | music = [[Andrea Centazzo]] | cinematography = Guo Yong | editing = [[Roberto F. Canuto]]
[[Xu Xiaoxi]] | studio = Almost Red Productions | released = {{Film date|df=yes|2017|10|24}} | runtime = 20 minutes | country = Spain
China | language = Mandarin
Sichuanese Dialect | budget = }} '''''Sunken Plum''''' (Original {{zh|s= 沉李|t=沉李|p='''Chen Li'''|l=sunken plum}}) is a Spanish [[drama]] short film, with social realism elements, produced with the collaboration of Chinese companies {{cite news|title=Rodaje Gijonés en China (filming of an asturian director in China)|url=http://www.elcomercio.es/gente-estilo/201610/10/rodaje-gijones-china-20161010011527-v.html|accessdate=26 December 2016|publisher=El Comercio (Newspaper)|date=10 October 2016|language=Spanish|quote="Comedia melodramática con tintes de misterio y realismo social"}} written and directed by [[Roberto F. Canuto]] and [[Xu Xiaoxi]]. Produced by Almost Red Productions in association with Arkadin Ed. and filmed in [[Sichuan]], China. It is the last part of the trilogy '''Invisible Chengdu''' (aka ''El Chengdu Invisible'' (Spanish)), a series of short films filmed in Sichuan (China) and using the local language of the region, the [[Sichuanese Mandarin]]. The trilogy reflects the underground scene of [[Chengdu]]. It includes also the films [[Floating Melon]] (2015) and [[Ni Jing: Thou Shalt Not Steal]] (2013) and narrates stories about characters that usually are segregated and that must survive in the shadows of the city, since the Chinese society is contrary to diversity and individuality.{{cite news|title=Roberto F. Canuto finaliza un nuevo rodaje en China (Roberto F. Canuto end a new shooting in China)|url=http://www.lne.es/gijon/2016/10/11/roberto-f-canuto-finaliza-nuevo/1996053.html|accessdate=12 December 2016|publisher=La Nueva España (Newspaper)|date=11 October 2016|language=Spanish|quote=La película representa la última parte de la trilogía "El Chengdu Invisible", formada por Ni Jing: No Robarás, Sandía Amarga y Sunken Plum, que narra historias sobre personajes habitualmente marginados, que deben subsistir en las sombras de una sociedad, la China, contraria a la diversidad y la individualidad.}} Set on a contemporary city of China, it follows Li Wanjing, a transgender woman that must return to her birthplace village in the mountains after knowing the decease of her mother, since she must arrange the funeral, but she cannot present herself with her new identity in front of family members and friends.{{cite web |title='Ciruela de agua dulce', del cineasta gijonés Roberto F. Canuto... |url=http://www.europapress.es/asturias/noticia-ciruela-agua-dulce-cineasta-gijones-roberto-canuto-chino-xu-xiaoxi-estreno-mundial-seminci-20171010181637.html |website=Europapress.es |publisher=Europa Press |accessdate=30 August 2018 |language=Spanish}} The film is performed by Gu Xiang, a non-professional actor that face his first performance with this movie. Also in the role of Wang Dandan is Yu Yinmeng (that performed in a previous film of the directors, [[Floating Melon]]), Tian Peng and Li Lierong. Sunken Plum pretends to grasp the life of the transgender community in the Chinese society. In the words of the directors, ''We hope that with time things will start to change and these groups start to get the respect and rights that they deserve.''.{{cite web|last1=Schalkwijk|first1=Ivo|title=Een filmproductie over transseksuelen in China(a film about transexuals in China)|url=http://china2025.nl/transseksualiteit-in-china/|website=Het China Crowdblog|accessdate=26 December 2016|language=Dutch|date=7 November 2016|quote=Met het laatste deel willen de regisseurs transgenders een helpende hand bieden door het leven in deze gemeenschap in beelden samen te vatten en mensen aan het denken te zetten. Roberto: “We hope that with time things will start to change and these groups start to get the respect and rights that they deserve”.}} In Sunken Plum they try to represents some of the many difficulties that have a transgender woman in China. If focuses in the family relationships and the different treatment they receive between the cities and the villages.{{cite news|last1=Peláez|first1=I|title=Roberto F. Canuto, director gijonés, acaba de terminar un rodaje en China (Roberto F. Canuto, director from Gijon, just finish a new film in China) Interview|url=http://www.lne.es/gijon/2016/10/18/china-occidentales-considerados-potenciales-espias/1999627.html|accessdate=26 December 2016|publisher=La Nueva España (Newspaper)|date=18 October 2016|page=12|language=Spanish|quote=Print interview (web preview)}} Filming took place in September and October 2016 in Sichuan (China), and the post-production process was completed in October 2017 in Asturias, Spain. Distributed by Laboral Cinemateca, a company from the government of Principado de [[Asturias]], Sunken Plum had its world premiere at the 62nd [[Seminci]], Valladolid International Film Festival on the 24 of October 2017. It participates that year also in Spain at the 22th [[LesGaiCineMad]], Madrid International LGBT Film Festival and the 55th FICX, [[Gijón International Film Festival]], where obtained the "Laboral Cinemateca Award", that consist in the distribution of the movie at international film festivals.{{cite news |last1=R. |first1=J. M. |title="Sunken Plum" in London ("Ciruela de agua dulce", en Londres) |url=https://www.lne.es/gijon/2018/08/23/ciruela-agua-dulce-londres/2337373.html |accessdate=30 August 2018 |publisher=La Nueva España |date=24 August 2018 |language=Spanish}} The international premiere took place in April 2018 at the 9th LGBT film festival in Poland. In the following six months, it is presented in over 25 countries, participating in two festivals that qualify for the pre-selection of the Academy Awards (Oscar) for Best Short Film: the 36th [[Outfest]] Los Angeles Film Festival and the 26th [[Raindance Film Festival]] in London (UK), The film obtained various awards and mentions through the year 2018.{{cite news |title=The coproduction Astur-Chinese "Sunken Plum" selected in the Raindance in London (La coproducción astur-china 'Ciruela de agua dulce', seleccionada en el Raindance de Londres) |url=https://www.lavanguardia.com/local/asturias/20180822/451409054971/la-coproduccion-astur-china-ciruela-de-agua-dulce-seleccionada-en-el-raindance-de-londres.html |accessdate=30 August 2018 |publisher=La Vanguardia Newspaper |date=22 August 2018 |language=Spanish}} == Cast == * Gu Xiang ({{zh|c=顾翔}}) as Li Wanying/ Li Yong/ Mimi * Yu Yinmeng ({{zh|c=余吟萌}}) as Wang Dandan * Tian Peng ({{zh|c=田鹏}}) as Guo Xiang * Li Lierong ({{zh|c=李烈蓉}}) as Mum * Chen Jiaqi ({{zh|c= 陈家琪}}) as Cui Xian{{cite web|author1=Redacción|title=EL DIRECTOR ASTURIANO ROBERTO F. CANUTO Y EL CHINO XU XIAOXI FINALIZAN EL RODAJE DE SU NUEVA PELÍCULA EN CHENGDU|url=http://cineyteatro.es/portal/DETALLECONTENIDOS/tabid/62/xmmid/386/xmid/24795/xmview/2/Default.aspx|website=Cineyteatro.com|accessdate=26 December 2016|language=Spanish|date=9 October 2016|quote=reparto encontramos actores como Celia Yu Yinmenng, Tian Peng, Li Lie Rong o Chen Jia Qui.}} * Yao Zhexing ({{zh|c=姚哲行}}) as Manager * Zhang Zhijiu ({{zh|c=张智久}}) as Kiki == Plot == A transgender woman, who works in a nightclub in Chengdu, receives an unexpected visit from her cousin, who tells her that her mother (whom she didn't see for a long time) is deceased. As the only son, she feels obligated to return to her birthplace, but can not appear as a woman in front of her family.{{cite web|authorlink1=Ivo Schalkwijk|title=Even filmproductie over transseksuelen in China (a film about transsexuals in China)|url=http://china2025.nl/transseksualiteit-in-china/|website=China2015.nl|accessdate=12 December 2016|language=Dutch|date=7 November 2016|quote=Het verhaal over een transgender vrouw die werkt in een nachtclub in Chengdu. Onverwacht krijgt ze een bezoek van haar nicht die haar verteld dat haar moeder is overleden. Als enige zoon voelt ze zich verplicht om terug te gaan naar haar geboorteplaats, maar kan niet als vrouw voor haar familie verschijnen.}} == Pre-Production == [[File:Sunken Plum (Chen Li) (Dir. Roberto F. Canuto & Xu Xiaoxi) Behind the Scenes at the village.jpg|thumb|left|Picture of Sunken Plum (Chen Li) with directors and main actors]] The films start the pre-production process in summer 2016. The directors mention that "The production process was very complicated because it was not possible to obtain help from official institutions, neither from private funds because this type of works cannot have a normal distribution in China". It was partially financed by a crowdfunding project.{{cite web|title=Support Chengdu Art LGBT film|url=http://zaomengshe.com/c/318220|website=Zaomongshe|accessdate=26 December 2016|language=English and Chinese|date=31 October 2016}} "Many people collaborate, knowing that our intention was to bring attention towards the difficulties and the injustice that the LGBT community and in special the trans community suffer in the Chinese society. For that reason, this project is very special for us".{{cite web |title="Sunken Plum", form the Asturias filmmaker Roberto F. Canuto and the Chinese Xu Xiaoxi... |url=https://www.20minutos.es/noticia/3157473/0/ciruela-agua-dulce-cineasta-gijones-roberto-canuto-chino-xu-xiaoxi-estreno-mundial-seminci/#xtor=AD-15&xts=467263 |website=20minutos.es |publisher=20 minutos |accessdate=30 August 2018 |language=Spanish |quote="Reconociendo las enormes dificultades de esta comunidad para llevar una vida digna, careciendo de protección legal y sufriendo el desprecio de buena parte de la sociedad, decidimos escribir esta historia para llamar la atención sobre esta injusta situación Ver más en: https://www.20minutos.es/noticia/3157473/0/ciruela-agua-dulce-cineasta-gijones-roberto-canuto-chino-xu-xiaoxi-estreno-mundial-seminci/#xtor=AD-15&xts=467263#xtor=AD-15&xts=467263}} Produced by Almost Red Productions in association with Arkadin Ed (Spain), the filming took place in China.{{cite web|title=Support Chengdu Art LGBT film|url=http://zaomengshe.com/c/318220|website=Zaomongshe|accessdate=26 December 2016|language=English and Chinese|date=31 October 2016}} Being a co-production, in the practice, it is just a Spanish film, not only because the main founds of the film came from Spain, but also because the film cannot be distributed in China, due to the strict censorship of the audiovisual exhibition in the country. ===Writing=== The script was written by the directors, [[Roberto F. Canuto]] and [[Xu Xiaoxi]]. The idea behind the story came after the directors view some videos that were shared in social networks in China, but that was censored in a few hours. The videos portray the physical and psychological abuse of some transgender women.{{cite web |title=(An Astur-Chinese coproduction, selected in Raindance |url=http://agencias.abc.es/agencias/noticia.asp?noticia=2898472 |website=abc.es |publisher=Abc newpaper |accessdate=30 August 2018 |language=Spanish |quote=La idea de esta coproducción surgió cuando los cineastas vieron unos vídeos que se difundieron en las redes sociales en China, y fueron censurados en pocas horas, donde se podían ver maltratos físicos y psicológicos a mujeres transgénero por parte de autoridades.}} The directors mention: "''we were surprided that these videos were shared in a playful and entertaining manner. Knowing the great difficulties that this community must face to have a dignified life, lacking legal protection and suffering the contempt of a good part of society, we decided to write this story to draw attention to this unfair situation''". According to the directors, they ''"try to create a story with a simple and direct narrative, but with an important emotional charge, so that the viewer feels empathy with the main character and understands her inner world. Our wish would be that this short film could be seen both by the kind of people who shared those videos for fun, as well as by the archetype of people who are represented in the village, who are completely unaware of the existence of transsexuality and, therefore, they can not accept it"''.{{cite web |author1=NBNoticias |title="Sunken Plum" selected in the Raindance of London |url=https://www.eldigitaldeasturias.com/noticias/ciruela-de-agua-dulce-seleccionada-en-el-raindance-de-londres/ |website=www.eldigitaldeasturias.com |publisher=El digital de Asturias |accessdate=30 August 2018 |language=Spanish |quote=Según el cineasta, “intentamos crear una historia con una narrativa sencilla y directa, pero con una importante carga emocional, para que el espectador sienta empatía con el personaje principal y entienda su mundo interior. Nuestro deseo sería que este corto pudiera ser visto tanto por el tipo de personas que compartían esos videos por diversión, al igual que por el arquetipo de personas que aparecen representados en la aldea, que desconocen por completo la existencia de la transexualidad y, por ello, no la pueden aceptar”}} ==Production== [[File:Sunken Plum (Dir. Roberto F. Canuto & Xu Xiaoxi) Behind the Scene picture with actor Gu Xiang.jpg|thumb|right|Picture of Sunken Plum (Chen Li) with main actor Gu Xiang]] The filming process of Sunken Plum took place between the middle of September until 9 October 2016 in Sichuan (China). ===Locations=== The locations of the filming were the center of Chengdu, the lake "Bai Ta" and a village in the mountains of Sichuan, "Nan Bu". The main problem, regarding locations, was to find a suitable village that allow the production team to shoot a scene related to funerals. The superstitions, specially related to dead, are very strong in the countryside of China. The village that was use, "Bai Ta", is located five hours from Chengdu city, in the mountains, and the team needed to drive dangerous roads to reach the remote place.{{cite news|last1=Peláez|first1=I|title=Roberto F. Canuto, director gijonés, acaba de terminar un rodaje en China (Roberto F. Canuto, director from Gijon, just finish a new film in China) Interview|url=http://www.lne.es/gijon/2016/10/18/china-occidentales-considerados-potenciales-espias/1999627.html|accessdate=26 December 2016|publisher=La Nueva España (Newspaper)|date=18 October 2016|page=12|language=Spanish|quote=Print interview (web preview)}} ===Casting=== Sunken Plum is performed by non professional actors and some scenes required many extras. The main character is performed by the male actor Gu Xiang, that perform a complex character, "Li Wanying", a transgender person with strong family conflicts.{{cite web|title=EL DIRECTOR ASTURIANO ROBERTO F. CANUTO Y EL CHINO XU XIAOXI FINALIZAN EL RODAJE DE SU NUEVA PELÍCULA EN CHENGDU, CHINA|url=http://cineyteatro.es/portal/DETALLECONTENIDOS/tabid/62/xmmid/386/xmid/24795/xmview/2/Default.aspx|website=Cineyteatro.com|accessdate=26 December 2016|language=Spanish|date=9 October 2016}} Regarding the casting process, the director Roberto F. Canuto mention that they “''try to find a transgender actress to perform the main role, but it was not possible. Finally, we choose a non-professional actor, but that had some of the qualities and the passion that we were looking for, and we thougtn he will give a true personality and spontaneity to the role''”. Gu Xiang interview some transgender women and rehearse the scenes few months with the directors until he felt ready to affront the shooting.{{cite web |last1=Chávez Reyes |first1=Jorge Alberto |title=The trans short film "Sunken Plum"...in Raindance. |url=https://blogdelimagay.blogspot.com |website=Blogdelimagay |accessdate=30 August 2018 |language=Spanish |quote=El propio Roberto F. Canuto comenta las dificultades para rodar el cortometraje y ha destacado la interpretación del elenco actoral, compuesto por actores no profesionales: “intentamos en vano encontrar a una actriz transgénero para interpretar el papel protagonista. Finalmente optamos por un actor no profesional, ya que poseía las cualidades y la pasión que buscábamos, y le daría viveza y espontaneidad al personaje”. Según afirma el realizador, para darle credibilidad, Gu Xiang se entrevistó con varias mujeres transgénero y ensayó las escenas durante varios meses con los directores, hasta sentirse preparado para afrontar el rodaje.}} [[File:Sunken Plum Behind the scene. Roberto F. Canuto with actor Zhang Zhi in Chengdu.jpg|thumb|right|Picture of Sunken Plum (Chen Li) with director Roberto F. Canuto and actor Zhang Zhi.]] ===Crew=== Among the members of the crew it had usually collaborators of the directors, like the producer ''Leng Zhiwen'' and the director of photography ''Guo Yong'', with whom they already collaborate in their previous Chinese short film, [[Floating Melon]]. The music will be composed by the multi-awarded Italian-American composer [[Andrea Centazzo]], being ''Sunken Plum'' the seventh collaboration with the directors.{{cite web|title=Finaliza el rodaje de la película astur-china 'Sunken Plum' (The film Astur-Chinese Sunken Plum end the filming process)|url=http://www.asturiasmundial.com/noticia/88594/finaliza-rodaje-de-pelicula-asturchina-sunken-plum/|website=Asturias Mundial|accessdate=26 December 2016|language=Spanish|date=9 October 2016}} ==Release== The world premiere and national release of the film took place on the 24 of October 2017 at the 62 [[SEMINCI]], Valladolid International Film Festival, and the international premiere in April 2018 at the 9th LGBT film festival in [[Poland]]. In the first twelve months since the premiere, it was screened in over 60 national (Spain) and international film festivals and obtained various awards and nominations. Among the festival, the [[Academy Awards]] qualifiers for best short film, [[Outfest]] in Los Angeles and [[Raindance Film Festival]] in London (UK). ==Awards and screenings== :(Awards won are '''in bold''') * '''Laboral Cinemateca Shorts Award'''. 55th [[Gijon International Film Festival]] (Spain) * Nominated Best Short Film.
